title: Data Engineer (Snowflake)
description: We are looking for experienced <strong>Data Engineers</strong> with knowledge of<strong> Snowflake</strong> platform.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Creating and managing data in the Snowflake environment </li><li>Designing and implementing ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) solutions for transferring data between various sources and platforms </li><li>Optimizing the performance of Snowflake databases, including designing and implementing data structures and using indexes appropriately </li><li>Automating data processing workflows using tools such as Airflow or other workflow management tools </li><li>Deploying and configuring tools to monitor and report on the performance of the Snowflake system </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 1 year of experience as a Data Engineer </li><li>Ability to use Snowflake </li><li>Very good knowledge of SQL and programming in Python </li><li>Ability to work with databases, including the Snowflake platform </li><li>Knowledge of ETL tools and data integration </li><li>Ability to work in a team and good communication skills </li><li>Fluent English in speaking and writing </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>We Offer</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>B2B contract type </li><li>Full-time job </li><li>Remote and flexible working hours </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong>

title: Data Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Employer:</strong> DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong> <strong>Data Engineer (</strong>multiple openings)<p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong> Riverwoods, Illinois<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong> Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Responsible for designing, developing, testing, and maintaining complex data solutions for the product. Mentor and influence peers to achieve commitments on data solutions on time and with quality. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong> Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, or a related field, and 36 months of experience in Sr. Associate - Projects or related.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills:</strong> Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: implementing cloud-based solutions and using Amazon Web Service (AWS) knowledge to provide cloud solutions in platform strategies; creating AWS serverless solutions for data conversion and unstructured data transfers; analyzing complex infrastructure data granularities, data visualization, iterative prototyping, and analysis tools to define architecture and develop high performance cloud-based solutions; working with large-scale data transformation and data modernization; and analyzing requirements and creating technical designs.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $94,016.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at </em><em>MyDiscoverBenefits.com</em>.<p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls.  Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between to . Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. title: HR Reporting & Data Integration Analyst
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>In this role, you will join a fast-paced Human Resources analytics team as an HR Reporting &amp; Data Integration Analyst and serve as the Workday HCM data and reporting subject matter expert. This experienced candidate will have strong expertise in developing and maintaining simple to complex reports and dashboards specifically but not limited to matrix, composite, scorecards, and analytical indicators utilizing Workday’s report writer as well as other tools and available technologies. You will be an expert in building and maintaining complex calculated fields and have a solid understanding of the relationships within Workday’s Business Objects. In addition, this role will also support other areas of HR reporting including Tableau developed reports and dashboards from a data quality perspective, as well as data migration and transformation into our cloud environment. This role will be a liaison to Business Technology to support new and existing data from Workday to our data warehouse for continued use in advanced reporting and analytics development. As a Lead Reporting &amp; Analytics Developer, you will also be responsible for understanding and supporting data stewardship initiatives and the importance of security for all HR data the team manages. A successful team member will be extremely detail orientated, flexible with continuous process / system changes and comprehend the abilities and limitations from a reporting perspective.<p><br></p>Responsible for creating reporting solutions and partnering with technology teams to manage Human Resources data and reporting technologies. Designs and develops analyses on the employee population, including demographic profiles, turnover ratios, activity reports, and recruitment data. Partners with internal clients to address reporting needs. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Creates report solutions</li><li>Consults with internal clients on the development of analytics including: needs assessments, programming, and delivery of report solutions.</li><li>Identifies, troubleshoots, and validates data discrepancies between data sources. Provides solutions to improve accuracy and usability of data.</li><li>Develops self service tools that enable users to interact with data sets, process data, and generate reports.</li><li>Utilizes tools and automation to satisfy key compliance data requirements.</li><li>Manages HR data warehouse architecture in partnership with technology team.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Analytics, Statistics or related field </li><li>2+ years of experience in Reporting, analytics, relational and multi-dimensional databases, report writing software, internal client requirements, developing data-driven solutions, report building, HRIS systems or related</li><li>In lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in HR Analytics and reporting </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our say, we’d also look for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Prior HR experience in a data/analytics/reporting role</li><li>Previous Snowflake or similar data warehouse experience </li><li>Workday Report Writer experience</li><li>An understanding of data stewardship and security for all HR data the team manages</li><li>Strong expertise in developing and maintaining simple to complex reports and dashboards specifically but not limited to matrix, composite, scorecards, and analytical indicators utilizing Workday’s report writer as well as other tools and available technologies</li></ul><p><br></p>#Remote<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $74,000.00 to $124,800.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Excellent Opportunity - Data Analyst in Chicago, IL (Onsite) - Fulltime.
description: We are looking for <strong>QA Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Testing software, including functional and integration testing, performance testing, and automated testing </li><li>Collaborating with the development team to ensure code quality </li><li>Analyzing business and technical requirements to ensure completeness and correctness of tests </li><li>Implementing testing tools and continuously optimizing the testing process </li><li>Documenting test results and reporting bugs in the bug tracking system</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 2 years of experience in automated software testing </li><li>Familiarity with testing tools, such as Selenium, Cypress, JMeter, Postman, etc. </li><li>Ability to analyze business and technical requirements </li><li>Proficiency in English enabling communication at work </li><li>Ability to work in a team </li><li>Independence and initiative in decision making</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>We Offer</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>B2B contract type </li><li>Full-time work </li><li>Remote and flexible working hours </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong>

title: QA Engineer
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>Positions in this Job Family work closely with Department of Standards and Survey Methods staff and other Joint Commission constituents to understand and fulfill Joint Commission standards data analysis and reporting needs.<br><br>The <strong>Standards Business Analyst I</strong> c ompletes data entry and reporting tasks, helps to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data, assists in preparing technical documentation of manual and automated processes, and p articipates as a member of internal workgroups.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Performs standards data entry tasks, analyzes entries for accuracy and completeness, and works with colleagues to identify missing information. </li><li> P repares ad-hoc reports for various committees, senior management staff, enterprise colleagues, and the field, using SQL queries and SSRS Report Builder. </li><li> Writes basic SQL queries from scratch and modifies existing more complex queries, with accurate results. </li><li> Creates SSRS reports by adding custom code to existing templates. </li><li> Performs quality checks to ensure the accuracy, consistency, and formatting of data entered in the application and all data presented in reports for self and team-members. </li><li> Attends and participates in team meetings related to assigned work. </li><li> Collaborates closely with IT colleagues, following Agile Methodology, regarding enhancements and fixes needed for the database, application, and standardized SSRS Reports, including identification and documentation of issues and participation in user testing. </li><li> Participates in project meetings to understand database and reporting needs for the project. </li><li> Learns and follows policies and procedures and applies best practices in the conduct of work. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Associate degree required, preferably in healthcare-related or technical field; Bachelor’s degree preferred. </li><li> Familiarity with relational databases. Ability to quickly learn and master new applications. </li><li> Ability to follow policies and procedures. </li><li> Ability to analyze and synthesize data. </li><li> Ability to communicate effectively and professionally. </li><li> Ability to write clearly and professionally. <br></li></ul><strong> Note: Successful applicants for domestic positions that require travel to a customer site must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. <br><br></strong>This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by an employee assigned to this position. The description is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, knowledge, skills, and abilities, and working conditions associated with this position. All requirements are subject to possible modification and reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

title: Financial Analyst - Supply Chain Finance (Hybrid)
description: Job Description for Azure Cloud Engineer:<br><br>Key Skills: Azure Cloud Engineer who has Portfolio Management/ Trading /Financial industry background with experience in App Stack (must have some/all) - .NET Core/Azure Data Factory/ Azure Synapse, SQL Server/ Azure Functions/ Azure Data Lake<br><br>Looking for a motivated and experienced technical leader to be a key player in changing how we deliver technology for our Asset Management &amp; Investment Services business. This person will have direct and far reaching impact on Cloud adoption, Agile/DevOps maturity. The role requires working across a broad spectrum of technology, development teams and business partners. There could not be a better time to join our team as we transform how we deliver technology.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li> Serve as the primary expert for Azure based solutions to our Implementation and Sales teams. Stay educated and up-to-date as to the latest changes</li><li> Self-starter who can pick up new technologies/skills, be comfortable with ambiguity and drive initiatives forward</li><li> Identify end to end solutions, leverage best practices and patterns</li><li> Create Proof of Concepts, apply existing technologies in new ways, prove out new approaches and technologies</li><li> Provides technical governance and guidance in partnership with application development teams</li><li> Researches, models, and integrates business and technology architectures to align with business strategy, goals and objectives</li><li> Consults on a wide spectrum of existing and emerging technologies</li><li> Reviews high-risk technology projects for compatibility with IT standards and strategic direction</li><li> Develop and execute machine learning models on the NTAM Azure cloud platform to serve business goals</li><li> Help define and execute the strategic vision for data science and predictive modeling to meet the vast pent-up demand of our business</li><li> Nurture junior data scientists to help them achieve their best</li><li> Improve the maturity of data driven decision making, and bring actionable insights to our business</li><li> Create machine learning POCs and present them to NTAM executives; this requires an understanding of the business problem and leading with hypotheses to appropriately structure the data &amp; model<br><br></li></ul><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience</li><li> 5+ years’ experience with the concepts, philosophies and tools behind the design of applications, information and underlying information technologies</li><li> 10+ years’ core application development experience. Implementing applications and end to end solutions/designs.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Skills/Experience<br></strong><ul><li> 5+ years coming in a lead Application Architect/Senior Application Developer role</li><li> Strong interpersonal skills with excellent verbal and written communication</li><li> Collaborative style with an ability to achieve consensus</li><li> Proven technical leader</li><li> Design of an application’s code base, layering, componentization, framework selection</li><li> App Stack (must have some/all) - .NET Core/Framework, WPF,WCF, REST, Microservice, Infragistics, React</li><li> Cloud (Desired) – Microsoft Azure</li><li> Delivery (Required) – proven track record with CI/CD, Agile/DevOps, Test Automation</li><li> Database experience (Preferred) - SQL/no-SQL (Oracle/MS SQL), large/complex datasets, data modelling, performance, platform evolution, data delivery</li><li> Messaging Middleware – IBM MQ/ Solace/ Kafka(desirable)</li><li> End to end system solutioning/exposure…Security, Performance, Availability, Scalability.</li><li> Information Security and Financial Services domain knowledge a big plus</li><li> Experience building applications and/or running machine learning models on public cloud based platforms such as (preferably) Azure Stack (Azure Machine Learning/ Azure Data Factory/ Azure Synapse, SQL Server/ Azure Data Lake)</li><li> Experience in using a shared code base and version control using GIT</li><li> Experience in deploying models and/or applications from a development to production environment using CI/CD pipelines</li><li> Advanced programmatic data visualization skills in Python (Seaborn, Plot.ly, etc), Javascript/HTML/CSS, or R</li><li> Familiarity with database topics such as SQL/no-SQL (Oracle/MS SQL), large/complex datasets, data modelling, performance, platform evolution, and data delivery</li><li> Understanding of the SCRUM Agile process</li><li> Financial Services domain knowledge</li></ul>

title: Standard Bus Analyst I
description: <em>Tegus is the leading market intelligence platform for key decision makers. We power some of the world’s most well-respected institutional investors, corporations, and consultancies through the largest and most comprehensive database of primary and market information. Our products and services enable clients to discover unmatched insights and answers to the most challenging questions they face to help them make better informed decisions.</em><p><br></p>Tegus facilitates extremely valuable calls between our clients and experts. Given the proprietary insights in these conversations, compliance is critical to our business, and a key component of our value add. You’ll be on the front lines, ensuring our policies and procedures are correctly enforced before and after all Tegus calls.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Act as a self-starter within a flat, start-up environment, while working closely with a highly collaborative Compliance Team. </li><li>Utilize extensive knowledge of Tegus’ cutting edge Compliance program to detect material nonpublic and confidential information in transcripts, and ensure information is redacted in accordance with internal protocols, applicable laws/regulations, and industry standards.</li><li>Conduct advanced research to determine the extent to which information exists in the public domain. </li><li>Complete due diligence review of each call and document any instances where Tegus sourcing guidelines are not adhered to.</li><li>Work with Tegus Experts to resolve all compliance flags re: material nonpublic information, and personal/identifiable information. </li><li>Stay on top of internal/external communications and operate efficiently in a time-sensitive environment.</li><li>Perform a variety of administrative tasks, including but not limited to, inputting and tracking various types of data on our processes, transcripts, and workflows.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>1-2 years of experience as a paralegal, legal assistant, compliance analyst, or similar is preferred, but not required.</li><li>Acute attention to detail with proofreading, drafting, and investigative/research experience. Ability to effectively prioritize tasks, manage time, and remain highly organized. </li><li>Skilled in project management, and able to execute deadlines within a fast-paced environment. Proficient in working cross-functionally, and thrives in a team environment.</li><li>Coachable, with a willingness to learn and improve. </li><li>Process-oriented and eager to innovate.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits &amp; Perks</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans. </li><li>401K plan with an employer match.</li><li>Paid parental leave for all parents.</li><li>All employees are granted equity through our Restricted Stock Units (RSU) Program.</li><li>Unlimited paid vacation, flexible work hours, and 10 observed paid holidays per year.</li><li>Employer funded long-term disability.</li><li>Fantastic culture with regular virtual company-wide events, including cooking classes, yoga, meditation and more.</li><li>Generous employee referral bonus program.</li><li>The opportunity to attend peer-nominated quarterly DEI events.</li><li>Working for a thriving, performance-based company that values promoting from within, career advancement and transparency.</li><li>Work from our state of the art office in the heart of Chicago’s Loop featuring standing desks, nursing parent rooms, gender neutral bathrooms, subsidized gym access, and full amenity floor.</li><li>Commuter benefits &amp; a fully stocked kitchen with rotating snacks and beverages.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Don’t meet every single requirement?</strong> Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Tegus we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.<p><br></p><em>Tegus, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, Tegus complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. Tegus expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.</em><p><br></p><strong>The only @email addresses we use are @</strong> <strong>tegus.co</strong> <strong> or @</strong> <strong>tegus.com</strong> <strong>. If you receive emails from any other domain (including .us), please assume they are fraudulent and let us know by sending an email to fraudreporting@tegus.com</strong>

title: Data Modeler
description: We're looking for an <strong>Azure Engineer</strong> with expertise in Designing, implementing, and managing cloud-based solutions.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Designing, implementing, and configuring Azure-based cloud infrastructure.</li><li>Managing Azure services.</li><li>Automating processes using PowerShell, Azure CLI, or ARM templates.</li><li>Providing technical support and troubleshooting Azure services.</li><li>Optimizing cloud infrastructure for performance, security, and cost-efficiency.</li><li>Implementing and monitoring security solutions for compliance.</li><li>Collaborating with developers and system administrators.</li><li>Staying updated with new Azure features and services.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in designing, implementing, and managing Azure-based cloud infrastructure.</li><li>Knowledge of Azure services and tools.</li><li>Programming and automation skills (PowerShell, Azure CLI, ARM templates).</li><li>Understanding of DevOps concepts.</li><li>Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.</li><li>Familiarity with security and compliance practices.</li><li>Excellent communication skills.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong>

title: Compliance Associate
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, RedMane Technology LLC, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Company Description</strong><p><br></p>RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.<p><br></p>RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation that prioritizes a highly collaborative culture. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.<p><br></p>The diverse and passionate teams within RedMane address complex, real world challenges. Technology is just our tool.<p><br></p><strong> The Role </strong><p><br></p>RedMane has a full-time opportunity for a Business Analyst as we continue to grow our Chicago based practice. As a business analyst, you will work within our project teams, designing and configuring integrated software solutions for customers in a variety of business domains, including Health and Human Services, Utilities, Probation, Higher Education, Healthcare and more.<p><br></p>Our solution offerings include custom design, integrated solutions that leverage third-party software and COTS products, and highly configurable, low code case management solutions that incorporate leading-edge technologies. These include cloud-based mobility, data analytics and visualizations, artificial intelligence, and machine learning. As a business analyst, you will work within our project teams to design solutions within these offerings.<p><br></p>You will also participate in small-scale planning and assessment engagements where you will work closely with our customers to present and document options, recommendations and roadmaps to support their long-term planning and strategy.<p><br></p>As a business analyst, you will work in a collaborative environment where you will play a key role in obtaining requirements from clients, lead and take part in JAD sessions and work with internal and external stakeholders.<p><br></p>Responsibilities of a Business Analyst include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Plan and lead Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions</li><li>Elicit and document business and functional requirements from project stakeholders.</li><li>Design and document user interfaces (web, mobile).</li><li>Design and document system interfaces for integrated solutions. Collaborate with customers and RedMane technical resources to validate solution approach and feasibility.</li><li>Create functional design documents.</li><li>Configure solutions that are built upon our SaaS case management platform.</li><li>Support team members through the development and testing of functional designs</li><li>Support client team members as they go through user acceptance testing of delivered solutions.</li><li>Provide status reporting, quality assurance monitoring and ensure adherence to procedures and policies.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills &amp; Role Requirements</strong><p><br></p>The Business Analyst will need to have:<p><br></p><ul><li>We are looking for people with aptitude, intelligence and desire. </li><li>Must have an interest in and willingness to learn diverse technologies.</li><li>Ability to lead design sessions and workshops with clients to capture functional requirements.</li><li>Ability to focus on high quality work under pressure.</li><li>Presentations skills and the ability to conduct design sessions with key stakeholders. Must be able to manage these sessions in a cooperative and controlled manner.</li><li>Direct and succinct verbal and written communication style with the ability to articulate technical concepts to a non-technical audience.</li><li>Problem-solving and critical thinking skills.</li><li>Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of products including Word, Power Point, Excel and Visio.</li><li>Experience as a business analyst in projects involving data analytics, artificial intelligence, machine learning and IoT is a plus, but not required.</li><li>Technical background and/or technical project experience is a plus, but not required. This includes experience designing and documenting requirements for an integrated solution with interfaces to third-party and external systems.</li></ul><p><br></p>All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:<p><br></p><ul><li>A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.</li><li>A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Travel Requirements</strong><p><br></p>The position may involve periodic travel to client locations within the US.<p><br></p><strong> We Offer You </strong><p><br></p>RedMane has an environment that offers challenging and interesting work. A place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm. Everyone at RedMane shares a passion for making a real difference for individuals, communities, and the world.<p><br></p>Additionally, we believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen. RedMane is very proud to offer employees professional and personal perks that include:<p><br></p><ul><li>A flexible work environment that includes hybridized locations and schedules with free catered lunches in the office three days a week. </li><li>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc. </li><li>A culture that promotes and fosters career growth through professional training and mentoring. </li><li>An employee wellness program that includes free access to professional fitness coaches, structured dietary/nutrition plans, weekly Pilates classes in the office, and events that range from 5k's to triathlons. </li><li>Opportunities to give back to the community through our RedMane Community Impact Team which organizes events like Feed My Starving Children, Toy Drives, and other charitable activities.</li></ul> Systems Analyst
description_json: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, RedMane Technology LLC, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Company Description</strong><p><br></p>RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.<p><br></p>RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation that prioritizes a highly collaborative culture. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.<p><br></p>The diverse and passionate teams within RedMane address complex, real world challenges. Technology is just our tool.<p><br></p><strong> The Role </strong><p><br></p>RedMane has a full-time opportunity for a Business Analyst as we continue to grow our Chicago based practice. As a business analyst, you will work within our project teams, designing and configuring integrated software solutions for customers in a variety of business domains, including Health and Human Services, Utilities, Probation, Higher Education, Healthcare and more.<p><br></p>Our solution offerings include custom design, integrated solutions that leverage third-party software and COTS products, and highly configurable, low code case management solutions that incorporate leading-edge technologies. These include cloud-based mobility, data analytics and visualizations, artificial intelligence, and machine learning. As a business analyst, you will work within our project teams to design solutions within these offerings.<p><br></p>You will also participate in small-scale planning and assessment engagements where you will work closely with our customers to present and document options, recommendations and roadmaps to support their long-term planning and strategy.<p><br></p>As a business analyst, you will work in a collaborative environment where you will play a key role in obtaining requirements from clients, lead and take part in JAD sessions and work with internal and external stakeholders.<p><br></p>Responsibilities of a Business Analyst include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Plan and lead Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions</li><li>Elicit and document business and functional requirements from project stakeholders.</li><li>Design and document user interfaces (web, mobile).</li><li>Design and document system interfaces for integrated solutions. Collaborate with customers and RedMane technical resources to validate solution approach and feasibility.</li><li>Create functional design documents.</li><li>Configure solutions that are built upon our SaaS case management platform.</li><li>Support team members through the development and testing of functional designs</li><li>Support client team members as they go through user acceptance testing of delivered solutions.</li><li>Provide status reporting, quality assurance monitoring and ensure adherence to procedures and policies.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills &amp; Role Requirements</strong><p><br></p>The Business Analyst will need to have:<p><br></p><ul><li>We are looking for people with aptitude, intelligence and desire. </li><li>Must have an interest in and willingness to learn diverse technologies.</li><li>Ability to lead design sessions and workshops with clients to capture functional requirements.</li><li>Ability to focus on high quality work under pressure.</li><li>Presentations skills and the ability to conduct design sessions with key stakeholders. Must be able to manage these sessions in a cooperative and controlled manner.</li><li>Direct and succinct verbal and written communication style with the ability to articulate technical concepts to a non-technical audience.</li><li>Problem-solving and critical thinking skills.</li><li>Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of products including Word, Power Point, Excel and Visio.</li><li>Experience as a business analyst in projects involving data analytics, artificial intelligence, machine learning and IoT is a plus, but not required.</li><li>Technical background and/or technical project experience is a plus, but not required. This includes experience designing and documenting requirements for an integrated solution with interfaces to third-party and external systems.</li></ul><p><br></p>All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:<p><br></p><ul><li>A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.</li><li>A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Travel Requirements</strong><p><br></p>The position may involve periodic travel to client locations within the US.<p><br></p><strong> We Offer You </strong><p><br></p>RedMane has an environment that offers challenging and interesting work. A place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm. Everyone at RedMane shares a passion for making a real difference for individuals, communities, and the world.<p><br></p>Additionally, we believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen. RedMane is very proud to offer employees professional and personal perks that include:<p><br></p><ul><li>A flexible work environment that includes hybridized locations and schedules with free catered lunches in the office three days a week. </li><li>Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc. </li><li>A culture that promotes and fosters career growth through professional training and mentoring. </li><li>An employee wellness program that includes free access to professional fitness coaches, structured dietary/nutrition plans, weekly Pilates classes in the office, and events that range from 5k's to triathlons. </li><li>Opportunities to give back to the community through our RedMane Community Impact Team which organizes events like Feed My Starving Children, Toy Drives, and other charitable activities.</li></ul> Systems Analyst

description: Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>Job details<p><br></p><strong>Chicago / Hybrid + Top Trading Security SaaS Company</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by Ryan Kilroy<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary $150,000 - $220,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A Bit About Us</strong><p><br></p>Our product simply is our tech and our strategies. We do our very best to create, code, and implement robust trading strategies in the financial markets. We cannot be successful without all three and this is the never-ending challenge, to stay ahead of the game.<p><br></p><strong><br><br><strong>Why join us?<br></strong></strong><p><br></p>Ideal hire is an experienced Python developer - someone who knows how to code, understands algorithms, and can follow instructions, but also can do design, architecture, analysis, and technical documentation. Hire should be proactive, dedicated, and knowledgeable. We tend to favor hires who can do multiple tasks (generalist) rather than one task (specialist).<p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p>Prior financial market/proprietary trading knowledge is necessary. Hire will help our lead developer with the coding of new strategies as well as system admin tasks – e.g. server config (Ansible), real-time messaging (RabbitMQ), task management (Airflow), micro services (Docker), system auditing, deploy automation (Jenkins), log management, database management (MongoDB, SQL), Python scripting, data analysis (Pandas, Scikit-Learn), etc. We strongly prefer hires with knowledge of Centos (Linux Distro) for remote servers, terminal/bash, crontab, system, SSH and SCP, Python 3.0, NumPy, TensorFlow, Click, IQfeed, CQG, IB, TradeStation, and especially Rithmic (API).<p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.<p><br></p><strong>Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?</strong><p><br></p>Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>

title: Systems Analyst
description: Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Position Overview </strong><p><br></p>The Engineer I, Interconnections and Grid Analysis will perform technical analysis to assist in the interconnection process for the different generation projects. Based out of Invenergy’s Chicago office, the Engineer I, Interconnections will also be responsible for assisting in other transmission associated activities and analysis, including interpreting the different market rules as they apply to the interconnection process.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Support submission and management of new Generation Interconnection Requests</li><li>Perform power flow analysis and market related evaluations as part of generation and transmission development activities.</li><li>Provide grid, transmission system planning and congestion evaluation, to assist in development activities mainly in NYISO, PJM, ISONE and SERC regions.</li><li>Review utility and ISO transmission expansion plans to identify potential opportunities.</li><li>Review utility interconnection studies (impact, stability and facility).</li><li>Identify areas for new transmission projects based on generation technological shifts and the corresponding impacts it has on grid behavior.</li><li>Utilize regulatory and compliance knowledge to identify and evaluate areas of critical impact for projects in the interconnection pipeline.</li><li>Interpret market rules as they apply to the interconnection study, construction, and operation of generation projects</li><li>Work with regulatory team to provide input on queue reforms and process changes as necessary.</li><li>Develop conceptual design of interconnection facilities and costs. </li><li>Assist in conceptual design of wind farm and solar electrical collection systems (34.5kV), substations (34.5kV – transmission voltage 115kV – 230kV – 345kV), and project owned transmission lines.</li><li>Perform technical diligence for potential M&amp;A projects</li><li>Perform complex Transmission delivery assessments to support Origination and business opportunities for RFPs.</li><li>Coordinate with consultants to prepare system models and perform reliability and economic studies.</li><li>Establish relationships with various technical experts among stakeholders, utilities, RTO/ISOs.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS or MS in Electrical Engineering with a focus on power systems</li><li>0-1 year of experience in transmission system planning, compliance and operations including complex power flow, short circuit, and stability studies.</li><li>Proficiency in spreadsheet modeling using Microsoft Excel.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of FERC, NERC standards related to transmission and interconnections, including Open Access Transmission Tariff (OATT) a plus.</li><li>NYISO, PJM, SERC, ISONE experience preferred.</li><li>Experienced in the use one of power flow software such as PSS/E, TARA, PowerWorld, PSLF, or PSCAD similar software package a plus. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), bonus, paid time off, etc.<p><br></p>Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.

title: Python Trading Engineer
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>Positions in this Job Family work closely with Department of Standards and Survey Methods staff and other Joint Commission constituents to understand and fulfill Joint Commission standards data analysis and reporting needs.<br><br>The <strong>Standards Business Analyst II</strong> independently c ompletes data entry and reporting tasks, ensures the accuracy and consistency of data, prepares technical documentation of manual and automated processes, actively p articipates as a member of internal workgroups, and s upports division staff on technical and database issues.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Performs standards data entry tasks, analyzes entries for accuracy and completeness, a nd works with colleagues to identify missing information. Additionally, determines impacts of the data entry to other projects, areas of the database, or standards manuals. </li><li> Prepares ad-hoc reports for various committees, senior management staff, enterprise colleagues, and the field, using SQL queries, SSRS Report Builder, and Power BI. </li><li> Writes moderately complex SQL queries from scratch with accurate results. </li><li> Creates SSRS reports from scratch or by modifying or adding custom code to existing templates. </li><li> Performs quality checks to ensure the accuracy, consistency, and formatting of data entered in the application and all data presented in reports for self and team-members. </li><li> Actively participates in team meetings related to assigned work. </li><li> Participates in project meetings to understand database and reporting needs for the project. In addition, scopes requested work for length, difficulty, and whether process or technical enhancements will be needed; communicates scope to manager and project team to support project planning. </li><li> Collaborates closely with IT colleagues, following Agile Methodology, regarding enhancements and fixes needed for the database, application, and standardized SSRS Reports; including identification and documentation of issues, creation of user stories and acceptance criteria, participation in user testing, development of testing plans, and confirmation that changes were made appropriately in production. </li><li> Applies process knowledge and best practices from one project to the next and discerns when standard protocols apply and when a unique approach may be warranted. Develops standard operating procedures when needed and assists in educating colleagues on the procedures. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><ul><li> Associate degree required, preferably in healthcare-related or technical field; Bachelor’s degree preferred. </li><li> Two to four years of work experience. Experience in the following areas is desirable:</li><li> Design, query, and reporting experience with relational databases (Access, SQL) </li><li> Power BI </li><li> SharePoint </li><li> Technical writing </li><li> Process improvement </li><li> Ability to follow policies and procedures, but to discern when standard protocols apply and when a unique approach may be warranted. </li><li> Ability to analyze and synthesize data. </li><li> Ability to communicate effectively and professionally. </li><li> Ability to write clearly and professionally. <br></li></ul><strong> Note: Successful applicants for domestic positions that require travel to a customer site must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. <br><br></strong>This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by an employee assigned to this position. The description is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, knowledge, skills, and abilities, and working conditions associated with this position. All requirements are subject to possible modification and reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

title: Engineer I Interconnection and Grid Analysis
description: DeepSight Technology Inc. is actively searching for a GPU Software Engineer to apply to join our amazing medical imaging team full-time in our St. Louis, MO or Santa Clara, CA office!<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>We are an innovative medical imaging company that invests in our team and offers real opportunities for career growth. This GPU Software Engineer position works 2-3 days per week at one of our US offices in the St. Louis or San Francisco Bay areas and earns a <strong>competitive salary of $60,000-$166,000 a year, based on skills, experience, and office location.</strong> We provide top-notch benefits and perks, including health, vision, dental, stock options, and a 401(k)-retirement plan.<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>n<p><br></p><strong><u>About Deepsight Technology Inc.</u></strong><p><br></p>n<p><br></p>DeepSight Technology Inc. is a stealth mode startup company that has developed breakthrough technology in ultrasound imaging. This new technology will extend both the range and clarity over current systems by 10x - 100x! We are setting new standards that will dramatically improve the capabilities of ultrasound for many years.<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>In order to develop and improve this technology, we need dedicated team players on our side. Not only do we offer a great team-oriented environment, but we also offer competitive compensation and generous benefits.<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>ARE YOU A GOOD FIT?<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>We are looking for someone who is motivated to do quality work and excited about developing state-of-the art medical technology that will impact the future of medical care. Ask yourself: Are you analytical? Are you ready for a life-changing opportunity? Are you self-motivated and goal-oriented? If so, we want to meet you!<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU AS A GPU SOFTWARE ENGINEER<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>As our GPU Software Engineer, you take pride in your role in developing a fast, efficient data flow and algorithms for our advanced ultrasound systems. Being a team player, you enjoy working with our transducer, hardware, and systems teams as you work to optimize our system prototype and product designs. You utilize your robust knowledge and skillset to assist in developing the software architecture and efficient fast algorithms of our next-generation, high-quality medical imaging systems. Additionally, you utilize C/C++ and CUDA to design our imaging pipeline and implement its components. At the end of the day, you enjoy the variety that each day brings, and are proud of the work you do that ultimately leads to future medical imaging advancements. If you can do this and meet the following requirements, apply today!<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>n<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>n<p><br></p>n<p><br></p><ul><li>Implement complex algorithms from concept or prototypes</li></ul><p><br></p>n<p><br></p><ul><li>Improve speed and efficiency of image reconstruction algorithms</li></ul><p><br></p>n<p><br></p><ul><li>Work collaboratively with image reconstruction algorithm researchers</li></ul><p><br></p>n<p><br></p><ul><li>Maintain detailed design documentation</li></ul><p><br></p>nn<p><br></p>n<p><br></p><strong><u>Education And Experience Minimum Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p>n<p><br></p>n<p><br></p><ul><li>BS in an engineering or computer science field </li></ul><p><br></p>n<p><br></p><ul><li>5 or more years of experience in commercial software development</li></ul><p><br></p>n<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in concurrent/parallel programming-multithreading, multiprocessing, GPU acceleration (CUDA, CuPy, Numba, OpenCL)</li></ul><p><br></p>n<p><br></p><ul><li>Passionate about medical devices, with excellent communication and teamwork skills</li></ul><p><br></p>nn<p><br></p>n<p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Skills And Experience</u></strong><p><br></p>n<p><br></p>n<p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of digital signal processing , image processing, or image reconstruction</li></ul><p><br></p>n<p><br></p><ul><li>Proficiency with C++ programming and multi-threaded applications</li></ul><p><br></p>n<p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge in medical imaging (Ultrasound, PET, SPECT, CT, MR, etc.) and developing software in the medical industry (FDA regulated)</li></ul><p><br></p>n<p><br></p><ul><li>Expertise in ultrasound physics, signal and image processing, beamforming, transducer optimization, simulation, algorithm development, or tool development</li></ul><p><br></p>n<p><br></p><strong><em>Job Posted by ApplicantPro</em></strong>
description_json: DeepSight Technology Inc. is actively searching for a GPU Software Engineer to apply to join our amazing medical imaging team full-time in our St. Louis, MO or Santa Clara, CA office!<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>We are an innovative medical imaging company that invests in our team and offers real opportunities for career growth. This GPU Software Engineer position works 2-3 days per week at one of our US offices in the St. Louis or San Francisco Bay areas and earns a <strong>competitive salary of $60,000-$166,000 a year, based on skills, experience, and office location.</strong> We provide top-notch benefits and perks, including health, vision, dental, stock options, and a 401(k)-retirement plan.<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>n<p><br></p><strong><u>About Deepsight Technology Inc.</u></strong><p><br></p>n<p><br></p>DeepSight Technology Inc. is a stealth mode startup company that has developed breakthrough technology in ultrasound imaging. This new technology will extend both the range and clarity over current systems by 10x - 100x! We are setting new standards that will dramatically improve the capabilities of ultrasound for many years.<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>In order to develop and improve this technology, we need dedicated team players on our side. Not only do we offer a great team-oriented environment, but we also offer competitive compensation and generous benefits.<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>ARE YOU A GOOD FIT?<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>We are looking for someone who is motivated to do quality work and excited about developing state-of-the art medical technology that will impact the future of medical care. Ask yourself: Are you analytical? Are you ready for a life-changing opportunity? Are you self-motivated and goal-oriented? If so, we want to meet you!<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU AS A GPU SOFTWARE ENGINEER<p><br></p>n<p><br></p>As our GPU Software Engineer, you take pride in your role in developing a fast, efficient data flow and algorithms for our advanced ultrasound systems. title: GPU Software Engineer
description: Join our dynamic and inclusive team in Legal Services and take your career to new heights! We're a leading organization that fosters a collaborative culture, values professional development, and treats every team member with the utmost respect. At our company, recognized as an industry leader in workplace excellence, you'll have the chance to make a difference through your work. We invite you to bring your motivation, teamwork skills, and integrity, and we'll provide you with the opportunities and support you deserve.<br><br>As a Legal Specialist at our company, you'll play a vital role as a core member of our legal support team. You'll be responsible for handling benefits matters related to marital litigation and the division of retirement benefits under court orders, including Qualified Domestic Relations Orders (QDROs), custody orders, and subpoenas. Your day-to-day tasks will involve regular communication, both verbal and written, with retirement plan participants and external parties. Additionally, you'll provide valuable assistance to our attorneys, conducting research on benefit plan requirements and participant records, and offering general administrative support.<br><br>In this role, attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and the ability to prioritize effectively are essential. You'll have the opportunity to interact with various stakeholders, both internal and external, and your clear and effective communication will be key to your success.<br><br>Specifically, as a Legal Specialist, you'll have the chance to:<br><br>Review marital litigation and QDRO matters, preparing correspondence related to these cases.<br><br>Process the division of benefits according to QDROs and court orders, ensuring accurate documentation.<br><br>Maintain regular communication with participants, alternate payees, attorneys, and other external parties.<br><br>Provide financial and benefit plan information to internal staff, resolving issues and ensuring data accuracy.<br><br>Assist the Senior Legal Analyst in workflow management, including mail processing, document review, and record-keeping.<br><br>Provide general administrative support to the Legal Services department and contribute to various projects as needed.<br><br><strong><u>Here Are Some Of The Benefits You Can Expect<br><br></u></strong>At our company, we believe in supporting our employees' well-being and professional growth.<br><br>Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and well-being benefits from our HealthFlex Exchange, available from day one.<br><br>Generous employer contribution of 8% to your retirement plan, with an additional match of up to 2% from day one.<br><br>Enjoy a healthy work-life balance with 22 days of paid time off plus 12 paid holidays.<br><br>Experience the flexibility of a hybrid work environment, allowing you to be effective whether working from the office or a remote location.<br><br><strong><u>Minimum Requirements/Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience.<br><br>3-5 years of prior experience in an office environment, preferably in an administrative, support, or customer service role.<br><br>Advanced oral and written communication skills.<br><br>Proficiency in MS Office applications.<br><br><strong><u>Preferred Requirements/Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Previous experience in an administrative, legal, or employee benefits-related role.<br><br>Familiarity with benefits administration or pension record keeping.<br><br>Knowledge of pension and retirement benefits.<br><br>Wespath Benefits and Investments is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace.<br><br>Be the first to know about exciting opportunities like this. Subscribe to our job alerts for similar roles!<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 13.00 30.00 Per Hour

description: We're looking for a <strong>Salesforce Developer</strong> with expertise in Salesforce development and customization.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Designing, developing, and implementing Salesforce solutions based on client requirements.</li><li>Customizing Salesforce applications using Apex, Visualforce, and Lightning Components.</li><li>Collaborating with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze business requirements.</li><li>Building and maintaining integrations with external systems using APIs and web services.</li><li>Creating and maintaining Salesforce workflows, process builder, and automation.</li><li>Performing data migration and data quality management tasks.</li><li>Conducting unit testing and supporting user acceptance testing.</li><li>Providing ongoing support and troubleshooting for Salesforce applications.</li><li>Staying updated with Salesforce platform enhancements and best practices.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong experience in Salesforce development, including Apex, Visualforce, and Lightning Components.</li><li>Proficiency in Salesforce configuration, including workflows, process builder, and automation.</li><li>Knowledge of Salesforce data modeling and management.</li><li>Familiarity with web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.</li><li>Experience with Salesforce integrations using APIs and web services.</li><li>Understanding of software development best practices and methodologies.</li><li>Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.</li><li>Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.</li><li>Salesforce certifications, such as Salesforce Certified Platform Developer or Salesforce Certified Administrator, are a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong>

description: Opportunity to work for a proprietary global market maker, trading on major financial markets around the world. As a member of the Systems Engineering team you’ll be instrumental in an environment of continuous improvement, providing and guaranteeing a stable platform for trading systems.<br><br>Strong industry salary based on experience and interview<br><br>401K w/ match, FULLY paid health insurance, paid commute<br><br>25 days paid vacation<br><ul><li>3+ years of experience with Linux</li><li>Great communication</li><li>Excellent scripting skills, preferably with Python<br></li></ul>

title: Salesforce Developer
description: <p>Logik.io is hiring a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET). We are a new startup run by successful entrepreneurs that have built and sold technology companies to both Oracle and Salesforce. We are ready to build another great business and need your help. Our company is looking to hire a SDET who is passionate about their craft and hungry to learn. This individual will join our family at the beginning to help us build something incredible and join the fun of creating a best in class cloud product. We offer full benefits, salary and equity, great development tools and your choice of a PC or Mac.</p><p>The role of the SDET will be to develop automation tests for our automation suite. They will have the choice of testing tools to use and will work closely with an established software engineering team in Chicago. You will be expected to work autonomously at times and will be a subject matter expert when it comes to automation testing.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Design, create and implement automation tests in various toolsets (Playwright, Jmeter, JUnit, etc.)</li><li>Execute functional, integration and regression testing plans and scripts</li><li>Work closely with engineers and product owners locally</li><li>Log, track and document bugs discovered during testing as well as gather all necessary information</li><li>Document, analyze and communicate results of functional testing</li><li>Help train other employees on automation testing in the future</li></ul><p><strong>Top Requirements:</strong></p><ul><li>Experience with Jmeter and Playwright</li><li>Experience working with JavaScript and React/Node.js environments</li><li>Familiarity with Java or any other programming language</li><li>Understanding of SDLC and tools such as Sprints and Jira</li><li>Familiarity with API testing tools such as PostMan</li><li>Ideally come from a development background in both frontend and backend testing</li><li>Possess great Problem solving skills and have a Go-Getter attitude</li></ul><p></p>

title: .Net Developer
description: We are looking for <strong>C++ Developer<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>The duties of C++ Developer will include designing and implementing software solutions using C++, including designing and implementing algorithms, data structures, and programming interfaces. The programmer will also be responsible for testing and debugging code, as well as maintaining and developing existing software.<br><br><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Experience in programming in C++ language</li><li>Knowledge of design patterns and good programming practices</li><li>Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively</li><li>English language proficiency enabling smooth communication<br></li></ul><strong><u>Nice To Have<br></u></strong><ul><li>Implementation of beacon signal detection functionality</li><li>Experience in programming in other object-oriented languages, such as Java or C#</li><li>Knowledge of version control systems, such as Git</li><li>Knowledge of libraries and frameworks, such as Boost or STL</li><li>Knowledge of operating systems, such as Linux or Windows<br></li></ul><strong><u>We Offer<br></u></strong><ul><li>B2B contract type</li><li>Full-time job</li><li>Remote and flexible working hours<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br><br></u></strong><strong>Responsibilities</strong></strong>

The programmer will also be responsible for testing and debugging code, as well as maintaining and developing existing software.<br><br><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Experience in programming in C++ language</li><li>Knowledge of design patterns and good programming practices</li><li>Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively</li><li>English language proficiency enabling smooth communication<br></li></ul><strong><u>Nice To Have<br></u></strong><ul><li>Implementation of beacon signal detection functionality</li><li>Experience in programming in other object-oriented languages, such as Java or C#</li><li>Knowledge of version control systems, such as Git</li><li>Knowledge of libraries and frameworks, such as Boost or STL</li><li>Knowledge of operating systems, such as Linux or Windows<br></li></ul><strong><u>We Offer<br></u></strong><ul><li>B2B contract type</li><li>Full-time job</li><li>Remote and flexible working hours<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br><br></u></strong><strong>Responsibilities</strong></strong>

title: Java Developer
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>This position will contribute to the software release quality by applying primarily manual testing techniques. This role is within the Quality Engineering function. Quality Engineering supports quality related initiatives across multiple Chamberlain Group Business Units. A successful incumbent is expected to (i) Support high quality software and firmware releases through ongoing manual testing, (ii) document identified defects in a clear an concise manner, (iii) work with engineering teams to develop/update test plans to ensure coverage as new features are developed.<p><br></p>Job Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Hands on contribution to quality assurance through primarily manual testing methods and may involve testing of the one or more of the following depending on assignment: mobile apps (Android and iOS), web sites, hardware products (such as Garage Door Opene</li><li>Adhere to best practices for firmware, web, middleware, and mobile-based applications</li><li>Mentor junior Quality Engineering staff members with internal processes and best practices</li><li>Support senior staff members to define process and strategy associated with testing</li><li>Plan test schedules or strategies in accordance with project scope / delivery dates</li><li>Responsible for creation, execution, and maintenance of test plans</li><li>Continuously improves and revises testing standards, processes, methodologies, and documentation</li><li>Collaborate with agile team members, scrum master and developers</li><li>Manage complete scope of work assigned and coordinate with remote and external teams</li><li>Participate in Scrum, Daily Stand-up, Sprint and iterative development activities as assigned – be prepared to take on any role within the Agile team</li><li>Work with Software Engineers and Product Managers to ensure test cases/plans are updated as new features are developed</li><li>Provide accurate traceability and bug reports for Go/No-Go decisions and take ownership and accountability</li><li>Responsible for complying wit</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect Chamberlain Group’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reading professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p>Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field or similar experience</li><li>2+ years experience in execution of manual tests cases in web and mobile applications</li><li>Experience with Bug Tracking and collaboration tools (e.g. Jira, Confluence)</li><li>Minimum 2 years’ experience in agile testing</li><li>Hands on experience with mobile testing – b</li></ul><p><br></p>Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with sanity, smoke, regression testing</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills</li><li>Attention to detail and strong organizational skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Automated testing experience a plus</li><li>Hardware testing experience a plus</li><li>Proficiency with one or more of the following programming languages and frameworks: C#, Java, Python, .NET/Java frameworks</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

title: React Native Developer
description: <p>Skills:</p> <ul> <li>Minimum of 5 years' experience developing Web applications is required (An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of job-related experience).</li> <li>A deep understanding of Agile methodologies and Scrum is required.</li> <li>Experience in creating technical documentation is required.</li> <li>Experience working of RESTful services and the JSON file format is required.</li> <li>Proficient understanding in one of the following development platforms and skills is required: Web application development skills including JavaScript, JavaScript frameworks, Angular, Typescript, HTML, and CSS.</li> <li>Expertise of UI patterns such as model-view-controller (MVC) and model-view-view model (MVVM) is required.</li> <li>Expertise in RESTful services and the JSON file format is required.</li> <li>The ability to work independently as well as part of a team is required.</li> <li>The ability to lead junior and senior engineers on projects of limited complexity is required.</li> <li>The ability to recognize issues in existing software and put together improvement plans is required.</li> <li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are required.</li> <li>Excellent communication skills and the ability to work cross functionally with back end and quality engineers is required.</li> <li>Ability to interface with Product Owners and Scrum Masters for ticket/issue management is required.</li> <li>Ability to estimate work, support project plan creation, and report out progress to functional management at a project level is required.</li> <li>Understanding of CI/CD (continuous integration/continuous delivery) tools, frameworks and deployment processes is required.</li><br></ul> <p>Responsibilities:</p> <ul> <li>Work using Agile methodologies such as Scrum to develop software.</li> <li>Serve as primary point person and scrum team representative for interactions with product owner, front end, middleware, DeVos, and firmware functional teams.</li> <li>Participate in technical assessment, scoping and management of changes to the code-base on new business requirements, product enhancements and other change requests.</li> <li>Analyze requirements, collaborate with architects and senior engineers to produce thoughtful software designs of moderate scope and complexity.</li> <li>Maintain domain specific software knowledge of key software application features, frameworks, or components.</li> <li>Lead and contribute to technical discussions in community of practice, design review, pull request, or other technical meeting forums.</li> <li>Collaborate and work creatively with the user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) teams to provide requirements traceability from definition to implementation.</li> <li>Collaborate with other domain experts, such as Infrastructure, Database, and Middleware, as the team develops features and platform enhancements.</li> <li>Lead offshore teams to design and develop features and burn down technical debt.</li> <li>Adhere to coding standards and other best practices to create reusable code.</li> <li>Provide mentoring and coaching to junior engineers to increase software capability of the development team.</li><br></ul> <p> </p>

title: Linux Engineer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Motion Recruitment, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>We're looking for a Fullstack Python Engineer to join a quickly-growing HealthTech company with a brand new office in The Loop. Their cutting-edge prescription management platform helps patients renew prescriptions, set up delivery methods, and give feedback to their doctors regarding their symptoms and treatments to improve their healthcare. \u003cbr /\u003e \u003cbr /\u003e This company is leveraging its innovative technology in an untapped sector with lots of opportunity, enabling them to grow by 50% in the next 6 months. As a Fullstack Python Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining both front-end and back-end components of healthcare platform. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to create robust and scalable software solutions, ensuring high performance, security, and seamless user experiences. Required Skills &amp; Experience \u003cul\u003e \u003cli\u003eBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eProven experience as a Fullstack Python Engineer or similar role, with a focus on web application development.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eStrong proficiency in Python and related frameworks (such as Django, Flask, or FastAPI).\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eSolid understanding of front-end technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js).\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eExperience with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and database design.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eKnowledge of RESTful APIs and experience building and consuming them.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eFamiliarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and agile development methodologies.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eStrong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently as well as in a collaborative team environment.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eExcellent communication skills and ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment.\u003c/li\u003e \u003c/ul\u003e Desired Skills &amp; Experience \u003cul\u003e \u003cli\u003eExperience with cloud platforms, especially Microsoft Azure.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eFamiliarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eKnowledge of payment systems, financial technology, or related industries.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eContributions to open-source projects or a strong portfolio of personal projects.\u003c/li\u003e \u003c/ul\u003e The Offer \u003cul\u003e \u003cli\u003eBonus and Equity eligible\u003c/li\u003e \u003c/ul\u003e You will receive the following benefits: \u003cul\u003e \u003cli\u003eMedical Insurance\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eDental Benefits\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eVision Benefits\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003ePaid Time Off (PTO)\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003e401(k) {including match- if applicable}\u003c/li\u003e \u003c/ul\u003e \u003cp\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.\u003cbr /\u003e \u003c/p\u003e \u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e<p><br></p>
