title: Software Development Engineer in Test
description: We are looking for Angular Developer<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop and maintain robust and scalable web applications using Angular</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and implement new features</li><li>Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code</li><li>Conduct code reviews and ensure adherence to coding standards and best practices</li><li>Troubleshoot and debug software defects and issues</li><li>Optimize application performance for seamless user experience</li><li>Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in Angular development</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong proficiency in Angular framework (preferably Angular 2+)</li><li>Solid understanding of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and asynchronous programming</li><li>Knowledge of TypeScript and reactive programming concepts</li><li>Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git)</li><li>Strong problem-solving and debugging skills</li><li>Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>We Offer</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>B2B contract type</li><li>Full-time job</li><li>Remote and flexible working hours</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong>

title: Front End Developer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Collabera LLC, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Job title: </strong>Software Test Engineer<p><br></p><strong>Location: </strong>100% Remote<p><br></p><strong>Duration: </strong>12 - 18 Months<p><br></p><strong>Details:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will be responsible for monitoring all stages of software development to identify and resolve any issues as well as conducting tests before product launches to ensure software runs smoothly and meets product business, quality standards as well as functional requirements.</li><li>Design test processes and procedures used to ensure that software operates within defined requirements.</li><li>Implement test plans, manual, and validation strategies.</li><li>Identify and investigate issues found during testing.</li><li>Work closely with software developers and software quality analysts to resolve issues.</li><li>Develop and maintain manual test scripts.</li><li>Conducts routine tasks as directed.</li><li>Closely supervised with little latitude for independent judgment.</li><li>Typically requires atleast three years of relevant experience.</li></ul>

title: Fullstack Python Engineer
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial's 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The System Verification Test Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, Illinois will lead software engineering projects directly related to CNH’s precision farming products including auto guidance, telemetry, grade control and section and rate control. The duties include leading a team of test engineers to create test scripts to support the system verification team and leading a team of test engineers to define and execute strategies to increase the amount of automatic testing. Leading and developing test strategies for system testing and performing system test execution for each software release cadence with full verification loops of electronic controllers. Creating and maintaining test reports. Interfacing with the electronic component team to gather hardware specifications of electronic controllers, electronic instrument clusters, displays, telematics and other devices on agricultural and construction equipment. Interfacing with system, software, and functional safety teams to gather requirements of electronic controllers for telematics, displays, auto guidance and other devices. Analyzing and evaluating software and system issues to provide technical analysis reporting, create test reports, evaluate defects and communicate test results to stakeholders, ensuring traceability of test cases, test results, and defects to requirements, and maintaining the HIL (Hardware in the Loop) configuration and bench setup. Salary: $142,600 - $218,500/year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Requires a Master’s degree in Software Engineering, or a directly related field plus three years of automated test system development experience. The three years of experience must include three years of experience with each of the following: 1) leading verification activities including software review and analyses, system testing, hardware and software integration and unit testing; 2) identifying and resolving coding, ATE, integration, debugging, and software issues, using MULTI, Code Composer Studio IDE, Trakis Simulator, and Target; 3) working with hardware teams to resolve hardware issues; and 4) developing, implementing, reporting, and analyzing system test procedures using DOORS, Python, and Target Environment, and other applicable programs.<p><br></p>CNH Industrial America LLC' s ongoing employee referral program does apply to this position.<p><br></p>Interested candidates should apply online at http://cnhindustrial.com/<p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventive care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: Angular Developer
description: We are seeking an experienced <strong>Tibco Developer</strong>!<p><br></p>We are forming a team that will eventually consist of 5 individuals and collectively cover the following competencies<p><br></p><strong>(not every team member needs to possess all of them)</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Developing and maintaining Tibco-based applications and integrations.</li><li>Designing and implementing solutions using Tibco tools such as Tibco BusinessWorks CE ver6.x, Tibco Business Events (BPM), Tibco FTL (event streaming), Tibco Flogo.</li><li>Collaborating with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions.</li><li>Troubleshooting and resolving issues in Tibco middleware components.</li><li>Ensuring the performance, scalability, and reliability of Tibco applications.</li><li>Providing technical expertise and support to the development team.</li><li>Keeping up to date with Tibco product updates and industry best practices.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of 3 years of experience working with Tibco technologies.</li><li>Proficiency in Tibco tools, including Tibco BusinessWorks CE ver6.x, Tibco Business Events (BPM), Tibco FTL (event streaming), Tibco Flogo.</li><li>Strong knowledge of integration patterns and technologies such as SOAP, REST, JMS, and XML.</li><li>Experience in designing and implementing complex integration solutions.</li><li>Familiarity with enterprise integration platforms and ESB architectures.</li><li>Understanding of message queuing systems and asynchronous communication.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills.</li><li>Strong communication and teamwork abilities.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of Tibco API Mashery (API management).</li><li>Experience with Tibco Spotfire for data visualization and analytics.</li><li>Familiarity with cloud platforms and technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).</li><li>Understanding of Agile software development methodologies.</li></ul><p><br></p>If you are passionate about Tibco and enjoy working on challenging integration projects, we would love to get to know you!<p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong>

title: Wordpress Developer
description: Role: Azure DevOps<p><br></p>Experience 7-10 Years<p><br></p>Location: LTIM Client - USA Rolling Meadows,IL ( United States)<p><br></p>Technical Skills: (Primary)<p><br></p><ul><li> Demonstrate knowledge of cloud architecture and implementation features (OS, multi-tenancy, virtualization, orchestration, elastic scalability).</li><li> Hands-on experience on?provisioning and configuring IaaS and PaaS services like virtual machines, app services, databases, storage account, virtual network, function app, data factory, key vault, service bus, event grid, databricks etc.</li><li> Expertise with Infrastructure as Code automation tools and languages (Terraform, ARM, PowerShell, etc.) is highly desired.</li><li> Demonstrate knowledge of Azure DevOps and setting up CI/CD pipelines.</li><li> Experience with setting up Logging and Monitoring solutions using Log Analytics workspace, App Insights and Azure Monitor.</li><li> Demonstrate ability to back decisions with research and the “why,” and articulate several options, the pros and cons for each, and a recommendation.</li><li> Understanding of design patterns and solutions for high availability and disaster recovery for cloud applications.</li><li> Troubleshoot and resolution of complex problems within the infrastructure.</li><li> Work on designing/implementing/automation procedures for deployment, configuration, patching and upgrading of systems and applications.</li><li> Conduct analysis of production systems and performance testing results to identify areas of improvement within the application or infrastructure.</li></ul><p><br></p>Technical Skills (Secondary – Nice to have, NOT MANDATORY):<p><br></p><ul><li> Work closely with vendors, internal groups and outside agencies to provide technical leadership and solutions.</li><li> Independently analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time, providing problem resolution end-to-end.</li><li> Document implementation details for Operational teams and provide technical support as needed.</li><li> Share domain and technical expertise, providing technical mentorship and cross-training to other peers and team members.</li></ul><p><br></p>Soft Skills-<p><br></p><ul><li> As this is an onsite role, must have strong written and oral communication skills.</li><li> Insurance Domain Knowledge</li><li> Strong ability to work with client stakeholders.</li><li> Requirement Review and Work Effort Estimation</li></ul>

provide technical leadership and solutions.</li><li> Independently analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time, providing problem resolution end-to-end.</li><li> Document implementation details for Operational teams and provide technical support as needed.</li><li> Share domain and technical expertise, providing technical mentorship and cross-training to other peers and team members.</li></ul><p><br></p>Soft Skills-<p><br></p><ul><li> As this is an onsite role, must have strong written and oral communication skills.</li><li> Insurance Domain Knowledge</li><li> Strong ability to work with client stakeholders.</li><li> Requirement Review and Work Effort Estimation</li></ul>

title: Software Test Engineer
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company. Driven by its purpose of Breaking New Ground, which centers on Innovation, Sustainability and Productivity, the Company provides the strategic direction, R&amp;D capabilities, and investments that enable the success of its five core Brands: Case IH, New Holland Agriculture and STEYR, supplying 360° agriculture applications from machines to implements and the digital technologies that enhance them; and CASE and New Holland Construction Equipment delivering a full lineup of construction products that make the industry more productive. Across a history spanning over two centuries, CNH Industrial has always been a pioneer in its sectors and continues to passionately innovate and drive customer efficiency and success, driven by its purpose of Breaking New Ground. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial’s 35,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The System Verification Test Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, Illinois will be responsible for ensuring the overall form, fit, and function of new or current products when integrated into a single, complete system including vehicle displays, application controls, steering solutions, digital services and telematics, to fully autonomous driverless technology. This position will develop test strategies for system testing; perform system test execution for each software release cadence with full verification loops of electronic controllers and create and maintain the test reports; interface with the electronic component team to gather hardware specifications of electronic controllers, electronic instrument clusters, displays, telematics and other devices on agricultural and construction equipment; interface with system, software, and Functional Safety teams to gather requirements of electronic controllers for telematics, displays, auto guidance and other devices; develop robust, flexible, and re-usable test scripting for automated testing; create test reports, defects and communicate test results to stakeholders; ensure traceability of test cases, test results, and defects to requirements; maintain the HIL (Hardware-in-the-loop) configuration and bench setup; support application and system engineering teams with preparation of reports; support Design of Experiments and Design Validation testing; and identify and implement new procedures for process improvements. May telecommute two days per week. Salary: $109,410 - $163,300/year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Electronic Engineering or a related field and five years of experience working with embedded software development or automated test system development. The five years of experience must include five years of experience with each of the following: (1) electronic controller design, including software architecture, electrical circuits, and I/O circuitry for electronic control; (2) software integration testing and module testing; (3) supporting the design of experiments and design validation testing; and (4) HIL equipment including DSPACE or National Instruments.<p><br></p>CNH Industrial America LLC' s ongoing employee referral program does apply to this position.<p><br></p>Interested candidates should apply online at http://cnhindustrial.com/<p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventative care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: Tibco Developer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover </strong><em>is </em><strong>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with the following tools: AppDynamics, Datadog, New Relic and Insta</li><li>Application development experience, Kubernetes knowledge</li><li>Experience administering Infrastructure tools as well as installations.</li><li>Hands-on experience with UNIX and or/SQL</li><li>Experience in scripting and automation tools such as Python, PowerShell or Bash</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment.</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Vue.JS Developer
description: We are looking for an<strong> Unreal Engine or Unity Developer</strong> to work for Polish company.<p><br></p>The candidate for this position will be responsible for designing, programming, testing, and deploying games or applications based on Unreal Engine or Unity game engines. They will also create and develop tools, libraries, and systems that will assist in the game or application production process.<p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of programming languages such as C++, C#, or JavaScript, depending on the game engine</li><li>Experience working with Unreal Engine or Unity and knowledge of their tools and functionalities</li><li>Understanding the game or application production process and ability to work in a team</li><li>Knowledge of algorithms and data structures</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot and debug code</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Create and develop games or applications using Unity based on project specifications and client requirements</li><li>Design and implementation of the game or application according to best programming practices, including memory management, performance optimisation and testing</li><li>Creating and modifying scripts and user interfaces</li><li>Collaborating with the project team, including artists, designers and other developers, to ensure design integration and implementation of new functionality</li><li>Troubleshooting real-time technical issues and adapting to changing client requirements</li><li>Optimising the game or app to ensure smooth and stable operation across platforms</li><li>Maintaining knowledge of new technologies and trends in the games and apps industry</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>We Offer</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>B2B contract type</li><li>Full-time job</li><li>Remote and flexible working hours</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong>

title: Specialist - Software Engineering
description: <strong>Innovate here. And see your ideas come to life.<br><br></strong>It's an exciting time to work in tech at Edward Jones. We are making massive investments in emerging technologies to improve how we work with our clients and with each other. Relationships are the focus of our business model. And working in Technology here means using your skills to build, deliver and maintain the technologies that enable us to deepen and support those relationships. The best part? We develop and create our own industry-leading solutions internally. And you can be a part of it. Working with emerging new technologies. Creating platforms, programs and experiences that change how we work together - and support our client-first focus. Changing the future of our firm, the industry and the advisor-client relationship.<br><br><strong><u>Job Overview<br><br></u></strong>Position Schedule: Full-Time<br><br><strong><u>Team Overview<br><br></u></strong>We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced SIEM Engineer with expertise in Cribl and Infrastructure performance. As a SIEM Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of our Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) system. You will support and manage Sentinel and the entire SIEM dev stack, and be responsible for proactive monitoring of log sources, onboarding of new log sources, and assist with new searches and additional capabilities as needed. In tandem with security leadership, this role consistently assesses the threat landscape and adapts quickly to protect the business from risk. They must be highly technical and possesses at least 3-5+ years' experience in security across a wide variety of security domains to include governance and compliance, cloud security architecture, with knowledge of software as a service (SaaS), infrastructure as a service (IaaS) and platform as a service (PaaS).<br><br><strong><u>What You'll Do<br></u></strong><ul><li>Design, implement, and maintain our SIEM system using Sentinel.</li><li>Design, implement, and maintain our log ingestion capabilities using Cribl.</li><li>Monitor and analyze availability, capacity, and performance</li><li>Help identify and onboard new data/log sources that increase security visibility against use cases</li><li>Collaborate with other security and IT teams to implement security best practices and ensure the security of our systems and data.</li><li>Manage and maintain SIEM infrastructure and software, including upgrades and patches.</li><li>Provide training and support to other teams on the use of Sentinel and SIEM best practices.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Skills<br><br></u></strong>The salary range for this role is based on national data and actual pay is based on skills, experience, education, and other relevant factors for a potential new associate<br><br>At Edward Jones, we value and respect our associates and their contributions, and we recognize individual efforts through a rewards program that promotes a long-term career, financial security and well-being. Visit our career site to learn more about our total compensation approach, which in addition to base salary, typically includes benefits, bonuses and profit sharing.<br><br>Hiring Minimum: $92984<br><br>Hiring Maximum: $158325<br><br><strong><u>Skills/Requirements<br><br></u></strong><strong>What You'll Need:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelors degree in Information Technology, Telecommunications or Engineering preferred or related work experience.</li><li>Minimum of 7 years of experience directly related to technical area of expertise</li><li>Strong experience with Cribl and Sentinel, including deployment, configuration, and administration</li><li>Experience with security event correlation and analysis, incident response, and forensic analysis.</li><li>Knowledge of security threats, including malware, hacking techniques, and attack vectors.</li><li>Strong knowledge of networking, security protocols, and firewalls.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills.</li><li>Experience with Cribl is desirable but not required.<br></li></ul><strong>Awards &amp; Accolades</strong><ul><li>100 Best Workplaces for Millennials in 2022, published Fortune July 2022, Great Places to Work® data as of March 2022. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li> Edward Jones was recognized as one of the Best Workplaces for Millennials by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine. The privately held firm ranked No. 2 overall, in its fourth appearance on the list.</li></ul><li>2022 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women, published September 2022, research by Great Places to Work®, data as of August 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li>Edward Jones has been named to the 2022 Best Workplaces for Women list by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine, ranking No. 45.</li></ul><li>2022 Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For, published April 2022, research by Great Place to Work®, data as of August 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li>For the 23rd time, Edward Jones has earned a spot on the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® ranking by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine. Edward Jones ranked No. 35 on the prestigious 2022 list.</li><li>2022 Best Places to Work For LGBTQ+ Equality, Great Place to Work® in partnership with Human Rights Campaign Foundation, published Equity Magazine January 2022, data as of July 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li> Edward Jones scored 100 percent on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's 2022 Corporate Equality Index (CEI) the nation's foremost benchmarking survey and report measuring corporate policies and practices related to LGBTQ+ workplace equality. The ranking designated Jones as one of the best places to work for LGBTQ+Equality.<br></li></ul></ul></ul><strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 15,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.<br><br>In a typical branch office, a financial advisor meets with clients and receives branch office support, so they can focus on building deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis, Tempe and Mississauga provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. We continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.<br><br>Edward Jones does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.<br><br>
description_json: <strong>Innovate here. And see your ideas come to life.<br><br></strong>It's an exciting time to work in tech at Edward Jones. We are making massive investments in emerging technologies to improve how we work with our clients and with each other. Relationships are the focus of our business model. And working in Technology here means using your skills to build, deliver and maintain the technologies that enable us to deepen and support those relationships. The best part? We develop and create our own industry-leading solutions internally. And you can be a part of it. Working with emerging new technologies. Creating platforms, programs and experiences that change how we work together - and support our client-first focus. Changing the future of our firm, the industry and the advisor-client relationship.<br><br><strong><u>Job Overview<br><br></u></strong>Position Schedule: Full-Time<br><br><strong><u>Team Overview<br><br></u></strong>We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced SIEM Engineer with expertise in Cribl and Infrastructure performance. As a SIEM Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of our Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) system. You will support and manage Sentinel and the entire SIEM dev stack, and be responsible for proactive monitoring of log sources, onboarding of new log sources, and assist with new searches and additional capabilities as needed. In tandem with security leadership, this role consistently assesses the threat landscape and adapts quickly to protect the business from risk. They must be highly technical and possesses at least 3-5+ years' experience in security across a wide variety of security domains to include governance and compliance, cloud security architecture, with knowledge of software as a service (SaaS), infrastructure as a service (IaaS) and platform as a service (PaaS).<br><br><strong><u>What You'll Do<br></u></strong><ul><li>Design, implement, and maintain our SIEM system using Sentinel.</li><li>Design, implement, and maintain our log ingestion capabilities using Cribl.</li><li>Monitor and analyze availability, capacity, and performance</li><li>Help identify and onboard new data/log sources that increase security visibility against use cases</li><li>Collaborate with other security and IT teams to implement security best practices and ensure the security of our systems and data.</li><li>Manage and maintain SIEM infrastructure and software, including upgrades and patches.</li><li>Provide training and support to other teams on the use of Sentinel and SIEM best practices.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Skills<br><br></u></strong>The salary range for this role is based on national data and actual pay is based on skills, experience, education, and other relevant factors for a potential new associate<br><br>At Edward Jones, we value and respect our associates and their contributions, and we recognize individual efforts through a rewards program that promotes a long-term career, financial security and well-being. Visit our career site to learn more about our total compensation approach, which in addition to base salary, typically includes benefits, bonuses and profit sharing.<br><br>Hiring Minimum: $92984<br><br>Hiring Maximum: $158325<br><br><strong><u>Skills/Requirements<br><br></u></strong><strong>What You'll Need:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelors degree in Information Technology, Telecommunications or Engineering preferred or related work experience.</li><li>Minimum of 7 years of experience directly related to technical area of expertise</li><li>Strong experience with Cribl and Sentinel, including deployment, configuration, and administration</li><li>Experience with security event correlation and analysis, incident response, and forensic analysis.</li><li>Knowledge of security threats, including malware, hacking techniques, and attack vectors.</li><li>Strong knowledge of networking, security protocols, and firewalls.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills.</li><li>Experience with Cribl is desirable but not required.<br></li></ul><strong>Awards &amp; Accolades</strong><ul><li>100 Best Workplaces for Millennials in 2022, published Fortune July 2022, Great Places to Work® data as of March 2022. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li> Edward Jones was recognized as one of the Best Workplaces for Millennials by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine. The privately held firm ranked No. 2 overall, in its fourth appearance on the list.</li></ul><li>2022 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women, published September 2022, research by Great Places to Work®, data as of August 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li>Edward Jones has been named to the 2022 Best Workplaces for Women list by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine, ranking No. 45.</li></ul><li>2022 Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For, published April 2022, research by Great Place to Work®, data as of August 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li>For the 23rd time, Edward Jones has earned a spot on the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® ranking by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine. Edward Jones ranked No. 35 on the prestigious 2022 list.</li><li>2022 Best Places to Work For LGBTQ+ Equality, Great Place to Work® in partnership with Human Rights Campaign Foundation, published Equity Magazine January 2022, data as of July 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li> Edward Jones scored 100 percent on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's 2022 Corporate Equality Index (CEI) the nation's foremost benchmarking survey and report measuring corporate policies and practices related to LGBTQ+ workplace equality. The ranking designated Jones as one of the best places to work for LGBTQ+Equality.<br></li></ul></ul></ul><strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 15,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.<br><br>In a typical branch office, a financial advisor meets with clients and receives branch office support, so they can focus on building deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis, Tempe and Mississauga provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. We continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.<br><br>Edward Jones does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.<br><br>

title: Flutter Developer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer is responsible for all aspects of the software development lifecycle for Unix/Linux server solutions. Core competencies include but are not limited to: Linux and AIX operating systems, x86 hypervisors, scripting/automation, and x86 hardware solutions. Interfaces with Product Architect, Application Development and Operations teams on standards exceptions or troubleshooting of issues relating to hardware/OS/application integration.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SME-level accountability for a specific technology and backup/secondary responsibility for another technology.</li><li>Documents current environments, SOPS, future directions, technical designs, change tickets, and other items for internal operations as well as external auditors.</li><li>Will be the escalation point for other team members and knowledgeable of all team technologies.</li><li>Responds to engagements from the Command Center and 1st level operations teams to provide production fixes and root cause analysis. Available on a pager rotation for 24x7 support</li><li>Participates in Agile product meetings, deployments, and related tasks.</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and is actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years’ experience in large enterprise systems engineering, or related experience</li><li>Certification: Red Hat Certified System Architect (RHCSA)</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: System Verification Test Engineer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Wipro Ltd., is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Open for "C2H" only.</strong><p><br></p>We are Wipro (NYSE: WIT), a rapidly expanding and leading global Information Technology, Consulting and Business Process Services company with over 225,000 employees worldwide, servicing clients in 175+ cities and 69 countries across 6 continents. For more information, please visit<p><br></p><strong>Role:</strong> Sysyem Engineer<p><br></p>Location-IL.<p><br></p><strong>Role Description:</strong><p><br></p>Performs Problem determination and resolution of mobile Equipment and Software problems through the effective use of available technical resources. Resolves Problems, including completing all related administrative duties. Resolves Customer's Equipment/Software mobility Problem tickets.<p><br></p>Below is the JD- Field Support Engineer<p><br></p><ul><li>The Field Support Engineer will be responsible for the installation, configuration, and troubleshooting of network infrastructure hardware and software. This position supports a broad range of IT hardware and software.</li><li>The selected professional will be responsible for working with end users about the issues related to physical workstations, including laptops, desktops, peripherals, network devices, among others. Individual should also be well versed about remote troubleshooting and remote desktop support, Physical hardware inventory etc.</li><li>In addition, they will also be responsible for serving in a client-facing role to carry out imaging and deploying desktop equipment, fielding onsite escalations from services desk, supervisor and customer.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Responsible for installing, maintaining and repairing company and multi-vendor systems which include hardware, software and networking products as well as operating systems.</li><li>Diagnose and resolve various hardware performance issues, make decisions when appropriate related to replacing existing user workstation equipment and carry out the entire product replacement process, including the removal of existing IT assets as well as the implementation of new IT assets.</li><li>Takes responsibility for potential or desired follow-up services or problem escalation.</li><li>Should contribute directly to the implementation of new company service solutions, or short projects as per the supervisor?s directives.</li><li>Manage all IT assets, including tagging in / out existing and new IT assets as they are rolled out to end users.</li><li>Ensure the best possible experience when setting up new user equipment, perform the necessary onsite testing to assure existing and / or new employees have access to equipment, applications, and various other technical solutions.</li><li>Friendly presence and helpful attitude; good interpersonal skills and ability to work well with others.</li><li>Good problem solving skills; ability to visualize a problem or situation and think abstractly to solve it.</li><li>Ability to handle constantly changing flow of traffic; remain productive during slow times, be able to multitask effectively during busy times, exercise patience and professionalism during stressful situations.</li><li>Dealing with hardware and application support queries and issues reported to the Field Services team</li><li>Take ownership and responsibility of an issues from start through to a successful resolution</li><li>Escalate issues and involve experts wherever required in order to resolve issues as quickly as possible</li><li>Ensures that supported customer accurately completes the approved work request with the date and time of submission</li><li>Develop sound understanding of IT operations and related applications and IT systems as well as business related processes and procedures</li><li>Develop technical knowledge of each system within company profile and specialized knowledge of certain nominated areas</li><li>Maintain adequate knowledge of operating systems and application software used to provide a high level of support</li><li>Maintains and consistently demonstrates a general knowledge of company guidelines, processes, practices and procedures</li><li>When the restoration is beyond the scope of the Service Desk Agent he/she will escalate the issue/problem to proper tier 2 and 3 support team members</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience working in a field services support capacity, with specific experience in the configuration, implementation, and maintenance of IT assets (Laptops, Desktops, Peripherals), troubleshooting and resolving any and all technical issues which require onsite service support.</li><li>Knowledge and practical experience troubleshooting and supporting local area data networking (hardware/software/protocols and best practices).</li><li>Knowledge of Incident Management, Service Request management, DEPOT model etc.</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Desktop OS (domain environment), Desktop application related configurations, troubleshooting etc..</li><li>Knowledge of standard Microsoft Productivity Applications such as Microsoft Office and Outlook. Familiarity with all major web browsers including Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox, EDGE and IE etc.</li><li>Working knowledge of Apple-MAC operating systems and devices configuration and troubleshooting</li><li>Working knowledge of ServiceNow ticketing tool.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Wipro is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and makes all employment and employment-related decisions without regard to a person's race, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, or any other status protected by applicable law</strong> System Engineer

title: Blue Prism Developer (Remote)
description: Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>Job details<p><br></p><strong>VC backed stealth startup is hiring for a Rust Software Engineer!</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by Sydney Weaver<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary $125,000 - $300,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A Bit About Us</strong><p><br></p>Stealth startup backed by Polychain, Tribe Capital, and the Solana Foundation is growing! I've also placed 2 people with them and both have had fantastic feedback on the culture and opportunity. Their product is a blockchain ecosystem that will allow others to build out blockchain to their own application. They’re building a high-performance, modular infrastructure to scale blockchains by separating the “slow” part of blockchains from executing programs and data availability (similar to Cosmos or Polkadot just much faster). With their infrastructure, any application can scale and spin out as its own blockchain without increasing its security risk. They have a very competitive compensation package and great benefits.<p><br></p>In this role, you will be expected to have a deep understanding of blockchain technology and how it can be applied in various industries. You should also have experience with distributed systems and networking.<p><br></p>The Solutions Engineer (aka Forward Deployed Engineer) will work closely with customers to design and implement technical solutions. You will help ensure a great user experience and enable clients to maximize the value they get from the platform, from initial onboarding to ongoing support on questions, problems, or requests. You will also build ongoing relationships with internal and external stakeholders alike, incorporating customer feedback and working cross-functionally to ensure our product continues to meet customers’ needs.<p><br></p><strong><br><br><strong>Why join us?<br></strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Great health benefits package, Remote flexibility, PTO / Vacation, 401K + match</li><li> Great culture, innovative team, and growth opportunity </li><li> Highly competitive comp package with a base salary + cash bonus + token or equity. </li><li> Opportunity to make a high impact on both the company’s product and as well as the industry at large.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Meet with clients to understand their technical needs and requirements</li><li> Assess technology partnership opportunities and assist in developing the initial integration prototype</li><li> Provide expert guidance and support to clients during the implementation process</li><li> Collaborate with our engineering team to identify and troubleshoot any technical issues</li><li> Lead trainings for business users, developers, and partners</li><li> Stay up-to-date on industry trends and new technologies in the crypto industry</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 3-10+ years of software engineering experience</li><li> 1+ years experience working with including Rust</li><li> Bachelor’s in EECS, Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent experience</li><li> Previous experience working on a cryptocurrency product (ideally infrastructure) or willingness to learn</li><li> Passion for blockchain technologies and Web3</li><li> High emotional intelligence and ability to empathize with users</li><li> Excellent communication and problem-solving skills</li><li> Ability to quickly absorb new concepts and technologies</li><li> Ability to think strategically and understand the business implications of technical recommendations</li></ul><p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.<p><br></p><strong>Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?</strong><p><br></p>Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development

You will help ensure a great user experience and enable clients to maximize the value they get from the platform, from initial onboarding to ongoing support on questions, problems, or requests. You will also build ongoing relationships with internal and external stakeholders alike, incorporating customer feedback and working cross-functionally to ensure our product continues to meet customers’ needs.<p><br></p><strong><br><br><strong>Why join us?<br></strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Great health benefits package, Remote flexibility, PTO / Vacation, 401K + match</li><li> Great culture, innovative team, and growth opportunity </li><li> Highly competitive comp package with a base salary + cash bonus + token or equity. </li><li> Opportunity to make a high impact on both the company’s product and as well as the industry at large.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Meet with clients to understand their technical needs and requirements</li><li> Assess technology partnership opportunities and assist in developing the initial integration prototype</li><li> Provide expert guidance and support to clients during the implementation process</li><li> Collaborate with our engineering team to identify and troubleshoot any technical issues</li><li> Lead trainings for business users, developers, and partners</li><li> Stay up-to-date on industry trends and new technologies in the crypto industry</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 3-10+ years of software engineering experience</li><li> 1+ years experience working with including Rust</li><li> Bachelor’s in EECS, Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent experience</li><li> Previous experience working on a cryptocurrency product (ideally infrastructure) or willingness to learn</li><li> Passion for blockchain technologies and Web3</li><li> High emotional intelligence and ability to empathize with users</li><li> Excellent communication and problem-solving skills</li><li> Ability to quickly absorb new concepts and technologies</li><li> Ability to think strategically and understand the business implications of technical recommendations</li></ul><p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.<p><br></p><strong>Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?</strong><p><br></p>Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we’re passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial’s 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p><strong> Software and Electrical Engineers </strong> at CNH Industrial are a key part of <strong> multi-national </strong> teams responsible for the sustainable design, development, validation and delivery of <strong> world- class </strong> <strong>agricultural and construction</strong> equipment that <strong>feeds and shelters</strong> the world's ever growing population.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><strong> What to expect in the position: </strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li> Development of innovative control, digital and power distribution solutions for challenging multidimensional problems. </li><li> Create, monitor, and implement project plans ensuring timely delivery of corporate objectives </li><li> Collaborative creation and execution of validation activities supporting verification of robust designs. </li><li> Interactive working with diverse multi-functional teams and industry leading experts in a global environment. </li><li> Opportunity to bring designs to life </li><li> This position pays $76,000 to $114,000. ( Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as skill, experience and qualification for the role .) <br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong> What to expect from </strong> <strong>CN</strong><strong>H Industrial:</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li> Exposure to diverse and international cultures </li><li> Flexible and dynamic work environment </li><li> Direct customer engagement </li><li> Industry leading 401K, holiday shutdown &amp; bonus potential </li><li> A career journey with endless possibilities <br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Wide range of opportunities</strong> Available at nationwide locations such as:<p><br><br></p><ul><li> Benson, MN </li><li> Burr Ridge, IL </li><li> Casa Grande, AZ </li><li> Fargo, ND </li><li> Goodfield, IL </li><li> Mt Vernon, IN </li><li> New Holland, PA </li><li> St Nazianz, WI <br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Do you have what it takes?</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor of Science or greater in electrical, software, systems or related engineering subject area. </li><li> Off-Highway equipment and automotive interest or knowledge </li><li> Proficiency in Simulink, CAPITAL, Creo cabling (or similar tools), CAN and LIN network protocols, Problem Solving, R&amp;D, etc. </li><li> Ability to travel both domestically and internationally as the need arises. <br></li></ul><p><br></p>Our Software and Electrical Engineer team have flexible <strong>HYBRID</strong> work arrangements.<p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventive care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please call 1-800-889-4422 option 1 and then option 5, or contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: Unreal Engine or Unity Developer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ansible Tower / Automation Platform installation and administration skills on physical and OpenShift deployments</li><li>Experience writing Playbooks and assisting others in their automation journey.</li><li>Strong Linux skills</li><li>Python, Bash, YAML, Groovy, Ruby, Java, PowerShell scripting experience</li><li>Additional skills include vRealize Automation, Chef, NSX, Vault, GitHub, and Jira experience.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Site Reliability Engineer<br><br></strong>Power Home Remodeling group is a leader in the home remodeling industry, and has a robust technical infrastructure built to support both employees and customers. Power has a strong focus on company culture, teamwork, and the ability for everyone to contribute to achieving goals.<br><br>Power is looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to work at our headquarters location in Chester, PA. SREs at Power build and maintain the infrastructure that supports our mission-critical applications. The SRE department has a strong focus on automation, scalability, networking, storage, as well as deploying and managing core infrastructure applications, such as orchestration platforms, logging and metrics. The primary responsibilities of an SRE is to deploy and manage existing infrastructure, as well as guarantee the security, stability, and availability of existing applications and infrastructure.<br><br>Power is a fast growing company, and we are looking to onboard more experienced technical engineers to help expand our capabilities. SREs at Power will work with a focused and dedicated team of IT professionals to achieve their goals.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Maintain and upgrade existing infrastructure, using automation tools (Ansible, Puppet) and scripts (Bash, Python)</li><li>Participate in a 24/7 on call rotation using PagerDuty to respond to and resolve problems and incidents</li><li>Manage and help grow existing Kubernetes environments, as well as deploy new ones</li><li>Management of core infrastructure applications such as centralized logging and metrics<br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Soft Skills<br><br></u></strong>Ability to communicate and work effectively in a team<br><br>Ability to work in a Agile environment to track work and progress<br><br>Ability to propose and implement custom in house applications to meet business needs<br><br><strong><u>Required Technical Experience<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ansible/Puppet or similar automation tools</li><li>Working with container infrastructure (preferred Docker and Kubernetes)</li><li>Scripting in Python or similar language</li><li>Writing and using Bash scripts</li><li>Linux management and automation (Ubuntu, RHEL, CentOS)</li><li>Have participated in a 24/7 on call rotation</li><li>Git work flow</li><li>Monitoring and alerting systems</li><li>Visualization of application and system metrics</li><li>Experience with virtualization technologies (VMWare, OVirt)</li><li>Ability to effectively diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve complex technical issues</li><li>Designing, planning, expanding, and managing a complex technical environment</li><li>Working with centralized logging infrastructure</li><li>Working with centralized authentication and authorization systems (LDAP, OIDC)</li><li>Writing applications in Python (or similar language)</li><li>Debugging and updating custom infrastructure applications<br></li></ul><strong><u>Nice To Have But Not Required Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ability to work with vendors to set requirements and generate proposals/contracts</li><li>Hands on experience with hardware and physical datacenter</li><li>Ability to define and implement SLO/SLIs</li><li>CI/CD process and tooling</li><li>Familiarity with database (SQL, NoSQL)</li><li>Capacity planning and expansion<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>Full medical, dental, life and disability insurance plans that can be tailored to your specific needs and the needs of your family</li><li>A competitive 401(k) retirement savings program matched by Power</li><li>Competitive salary</li><li>All the tech you need - We'll pay for whatever hardware and software you need to work and make sure you're regularly upgraded to the latest versions</li><li>Personal development - We provide books, courses and conferences</li><li>Paid parental leave - When the time comes to welcome a new member of the family, we offer paid parental leave</li><li>3 events per year focused on internal development and improvement<br></li></ul><em>Power Home Remodeling Group is an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please submit the </em><em>accommodation</em><em> request to recruiting@powerhrg.com</em>

title: Rust Solutions Engineer - Remote
description: We are looking for an<strong> Android Developer</strong> to work for polish company.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have experience programming in <strong>Java</strong> and <strong>Kotlin</strong>, and will also have experience working with <strong>b</strong><strong>eacons</strong> and <strong>Indoor Navigation</strong>.<p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience working as an Android Developer using Java and Kotlin</li><li>Experience working with beacons and Indoor Navigation</li><li>Familiarity with libraries and programming tools for the Android system</li><li>Ability to work in a project team</li><li>Ability to create high-quality, fast, and efficient code</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Implementation of beacon signal detection functionality</li><li>Creation of algorithms that determine the user's position inside a building</li><li>Designing user interfaces related to indoor navigation</li><li>Integration of indoor navigation tools with other applications</li><li>Testing and optimizing indoor navigation performance</li><li>Improving existing solutions related to beacons and Indoor Navigation</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>We Offer</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>B2B contract type</li><li>Full-time job</li><li>Remote and flexible working hours</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong>

title: Software and Electrical Engineers
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>S&amp;C Electronics, a global leader for power reliability products is looking for a Software Design Engineer. Included in this position is the support of intelligent embedded software devices including microprocessor-based switch and fault interrupting controls. Candidates must have a strong background in design and development of embedded software on custom electronics.<br><br>This position is located in Chicago. In this position, you will report to the Senior Manager – Embedded Firmware.<br><br><strong>The work associated with this position includes, but is not limited to, the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Design embedded application firmware for microprocessor-based fault interrupting controls.</li><li>Develop embedded C/C++ firmware for low power designs, including hardware device drivers.</li><li>Develop and support PC-based engineer test tools as needed.</li><li>Create, execute, and automate Unit Tests.</li><li>Review and implement product requirements.</li><li>Participate in Agile scrum meetings and peer reviews of source code.</li><li>Investigate new technologies and create design documents as necessary.</li><li>Collaborate with hardware and test engineers to support verification and validation of products at the module level and system level. <br></li></ul><strong>To select this job as one of interest to you, at a minimum, you must have the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Being a team player is essential.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communications skills.</li><li>Good interpersonal and leadership skills.</li><li>Continuous learner and self-starter.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.</li><li>Demonstrated working knowledge of programming principles in C/C++ and Python.</li><li>Embedded software development experience.</li><li>Experience with digital multimeters, oscilloscopes, and logic analyzers.</li><li>Experience working with and writing drivers for common peripherals and interconnects, such as GPIO, I2C, SPI, ADC, DAC, UART, DMA, flash memory.</li><li>Experience with configuration management/process tools: Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket/Git.</li><li>Experience with embedded Linux, Zephyr, or other real time operating systems is a plus.</li><li>Familiarity with real-time operation and low power microprocessor modes is a plus.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Relevant Experience Required<br></u></strong><ul><li>2-5 years of experience developing embedded C/C++ firmware applications and device drivers for low power designs. <br></li></ul><strong>MAJOR PHYSICAL DEMANDS<br></strong><ul><li>Standing: Occasional standing for work on complete control assemblies.</li><li>Lifting: Occasional lifting of controls and test equipment, less than 50 pounds.</li><li>Walking: Occasional walking throughout the facility.</li><li>Carrying: Occasional carrying of light objects.</li><li>Pushing: Infrequent pushing of objects, possibly related to rearrangement work.</li><li>Pulling: Infrequent pulling of objects, possibly related to rearrangement work.</li><li>Bending: Occasional bending during access to equipment.</li><li>Reaching: Infrequent reaching.</li><li>Handling: Frequent handling of parts or tools.</li><li>Environment: Frequent handling of parts or tools.<br></li></ul><strong>S &amp; C - TOP WORKPLACE<br></strong><ul><li>For 2019, S &amp; C Electric Company was named the 10th-best place to work among large employers in the Chicagoland area by The Chicago Tribune as part of the newspaper's prestigious annual Top Workplaces list.</li><li>For 2020, S &amp; C Electric was named as the 15th-Best Workplace in Chicago Tribune’s 11th Annual Report.</li><li>For 2021, S &amp; C Electric was named Among Top 2021 Workplaces in the United States by Top Workplaces USA, the nation’s most credible employer-recognition program.</li></ul>
industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Renewable Energy Semiconductor Manufacturing, and Utilities

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Contract - ServiceNow Engineer (Contract to Hire)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Rate: </strong>Open.<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Chicago, IL or Dallas, TX.<p><br></p><strong>Hybrid:</strong> 3 days on-site, 2 days remote.<p><br></p>*We are unable to provide sponsorship for this role.*<p><br></p>*Contract to Hire or Permanent placement.*<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS degree required</li><li>10+ years of working experience in IT </li><li>5+ years of experience in implementing ServiceNow or similar platforms for ITSM, SecOps and/or GRC/IRM modules</li><li>3+ years of experience with Javascript</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON</li><li>Ability to write clean, bug-free code that is easy to understand and easily maintainable</li><li>Strong understanding of CMDB, including importing customer data</li><li>Experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), Agile/Scrum, and DevSecOps methodologies</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Contribute to design, technical direction, and architecture with various teams to build fit for purpose solutions.</li><li>Participates in code reviews, proactively identifying and mitigating potential issues and defects as well as assisting with continuous improvement.</li><li>Follows agreed upon SDLC procedures to ensure that all information system products and services meet both explicit and implicit quality standards, end-user functional requirements, architectural standards, performance requirements, audit requirements, security rules are upheld, and external facing reporting is represented.</li><li>Writes unit and integration tests to maintain quality technology improvements.</li><li>Performs application and project risk analysis and recommends quality improvements.</li><li>Manage Production Support on system functionality and provide fixes as required.</li></ul>
