title: DevOps Engineer
description: <strong>Site Reliability Engineer<br><br></strong>Power Home Remodeling group is a leader in the home remodeling industry, and has a robust technical infrastructure built to support both employees and customers. Power has a strong focus on company culture, teamwork, and the ability for everyone to contribute to achieving goals.<br><br>Power is looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to work at our headquarters location in Chester, PA. SREs at Power build and maintain the infrastructure that supports our mission-critical applications. The SRE department has a strong focus on automation, scalability, networking, storage, as well as deploying and managing core infrastructure applications, such as orchestration platforms, logging and metrics. The primary responsibilities of an SRE is to deploy and manage existing infrastructure, as well as guarantee the security, stability, and availability of existing applications and infrastructure.<br><br>Power is a fast growing company, and we are looking to onboard more experienced technical engineers to help expand our capabilities. SREs at Power will work with a focused and dedicated team of IT professionals to achieve their goals.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Maintain and upgrade existing infrastructure, using automation tools (Ansible, Puppet) and scripts (Bash, Python)</li><li>Participate in a 24/7 on call rotation using PagerDuty to respond to and resolve problems and incidents</li><li>Manage and help grow existing Kubernetes environments, as well as deploy new ones</li><li>Management of core infrastructure applications such as centralized logging and metrics<br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Soft Skills<br><br></u></strong>Ability to communicate and work effectively in a team<br><br>Ability to work in a Agile environment to track work and progress<br><br>Ability to propose and implement custom in house applications to meet business needs<br><br><strong><u>Required Technical Experience<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ansible/Puppet or similar automation tools</li><li>Working with container infrastructure (preferred Docker and Kubernetes)</li><li>Scripting in Python or similar language</li><li>Writing and using Bash scripts</li><li>Linux management and automation (Ubuntu, RHEL, CentOS)</li><li>Have participated in a 24/7 on call rotation</li><li>Git work flow</li><li>Monitoring and alerting systems</li><li>Visualization of application and system metrics</li><li>Experience with virtualization technologies (VMWare, OVirt)</li><li>Ability to effectively diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve complex technical issues</li><li>Designing, planning, expanding, and managing a complex technical environment</li><li>Working with centralized logging infrastructure</li><li>Working with centralized authentication and authorization systems (LDAP, OIDC)</li><li>Writing applications in Python (or similar language)</li><li>Debugging and updating custom infrastructure applications<br></li></ul><strong><u>Nice To Have But Not Required Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ability to work with vendors to set requirements and generate proposals/contracts</li><li>Hands on experience with hardware and physical datacenter</li><li>Ability to define and implement SLO/SLIs</li><li>CI/CD process and tooling</li><li>Familiarity with database (SQL, NoSQL)</li><li>Capacity planning and expansion<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>Full medical, dental, life and disability insurance plans that can be tailored to your specific needs and the needs of your family</li><li>A competitive 401(k) retirement savings program matched by Power</li><li>Competitive salary</li><li>All the tech you need - We'll pay for whatever hardware and software you need to work and make sure you're regularly upgraded to the latest versions</li><li>Personal development - We provide books, courses and conferences</li><li>Paid parental leave - When the time comes to welcome a new member of the family, we offer paid parental leave</li><li>3 events per year focused on internal development and improvement<br></li></ul><em>Power Home Remodeling Group is an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please submit the </em><em>accommodation</em><em> request to recruiting@powerhrg.com</em>

title: Site Reliability Engineer.
description: <strong>Address: </strong>USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza<p><br></p><strong>Store Code: </strong>Greenville Data Center - It (5118634)<p><br></p>Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company’s 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, which includes Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Purpose: </strong><p><br></p>Platform Reliability Engineer will help ensure service availability, identifying and automating manual processes, and bridging the gaps between product development teams and operations. Implementing operational improvements in availability, latency, performance, efficiency, change management, monitoring, incident response, patch management and capacity planning are all within scope for this role. Whether it’s done through code, the introduction of modern tools, and/or better processes continuous improvement and efficiency is the goal.<p><br></p>You’ll provide operational excellence with troubleshooting skills, ownership in supporting various Azure services<p><br></p>Duties and Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li> Builds, manages, and operate Azure Core Services with automation and infrastructure as code</li><li> Manages, and operates the continuous delivery framework and tools, manages, and automates the lifecycle of the different cloud platform components and help support product teams</li><li> Leverage cloud architecture, applying site reliability principles, full-stack troubleshooting skills across network, application, security, Identity, OS, Containers, on-prem, and distributed services layers.</li><li> Provide reasoning about system &amp; application architecture as well as be comfortable looking at code and offering feedback on how it can be improved to increase reliability.</li><li> Identify opportunities and drive the implementation of automation to improve patch management, service health, manageability, reliability, and telemetry.</li><li> Own, triage, investigate and resolve service issues with an emphasis on broad communications, learning &amp; teaching throughout the process</li><li> Design process or technology solutions that monitor, identify, and resolve platform, system, deployment, and environmental issues both prior &amp; post production releases, and ensure measurable improvements against Service KPIs.</li><li> Drive Security and compliance aspects for services in accordance with Azure compliance requirements.</li><li> Engage in service capacity planning, demand forecasting and work towards Azure cost optimizations.</li><li> Create and document Runbooks, Operational procedures, and Standards on confluence</li><li> Communicate on a deeply technical level with product engineering, project management and product teams to improve and optimize products, improve infrastructure, and evolve services.</li><li> Work within a project management/agile scrum teams in a support role as part of a wider team</li><li> Remain current on new technologies, methods and procedures including, but not limited to, coding practices such as Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment and Operational excellence.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field</li><li> 7+ years of IT experience focused on infrastructure which includes server, storage, network, security Identity</li><li> 3+ years of experience supporting, maintaining, and automating Azure environments</li><li> 2+ years of experience using IaC tools (ARM, Terraform, JSON,YAML, PowerShell, Github etc…)</li><li> Production experience in Cloud technologies - Azure IaaS, PaaS, networking, Azure functions, Azure automation and runbooks, workbooks, Insights, Security center, Azure Monitor, Log Analytics.</li><li> Ability to read, write, configure, design, and script end-to-end service telemetry, alerting and self healing capabilities for platform services</li><li> Ability to work in an Extreme Programming environment and work in a paired programming/operating model</li><li> Able to facilitate diverse teams, multi-task, and work under pressure to meet aggressive schedule targets</li><li> Hands on experience with IaC tools like ADO, ARM, terraform, ansible, PowerShell, python, azcli, github</li><li> Experience in service capacity planning, demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning</li><li> Technical and Operational expertise in Windows/Linux/VMware/Hyper-V/AKS, SQL and N0-SQL DB’s, IaaS, PaaS FaaS, Data, BCDR, Security, Management, Storage, Networking, Monitoring, Identity and Connectivity</li><li> Experience managing and maintaining code repos, build systems, and CICD pipelines</li><li> Experience in infrastructure and configuration as code, as well as service auto-scale capabilities.</li><li> Worked in Devops and Agile environments, Blend of both Development and SRE mindset</li><li> Systematic problem-solving and troubleshooting skills coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.</li><li> Participate in on call rotation. Participate, collaborate, and provide guidance in retrospectives.</li><li> At least 4 years of hands-on operational experience supporting the following or related experience:</li><li> Azure Virtual Network, VWAN, Express route, Load Balancer (L4/L7), Traffic Manager, CDN, Azure DNS, routing &amp; routing protocols like BGP, firewall concepts</li><li> Azure Identity including any of the following: Azure AD, PIM, Conditional Access, MFA, Azure AD Connect, Password less sign-ins, Microsoft Defender, key vault</li><li> Azure Governance, Security, Monitoring, Workbooks, Compliance, and cost awareness</li><li> Azure Virtual Machines, Containers and/or Kubernetes and/or OpenShift (infrastructure perspective)</li><li> Azure Storage Account, Disk, Snapshot, Backup, Site Recovery, file sync, Data Lake.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Certifications in Azure Administrator, Azure DevOps, Azure Solutions Architect.</li></ul><p><br></p>#DICEJobs<p><br></p>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<p><br></p>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<p><br></p>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at tad@retailbusinessservices.com.<p><br></p>For more information, visit https://www.retailbusinessservices.com.<p><br></p>Job Requisition: 306569_external_USA-IL-Chicago_6152023<p><br></p>

Windows/Linux/VMware/Hyper-V/AKS, SQL and N0-SQL DB’s, IaaS, PaaS FaaS, Data, BCDR, Security, Management, Storage, Networking, Monitoring, Identity and Connectivity</li><li> Experience managing and maintaining code repos, build systems, and CICD pipelines</li><li> Experience in infrastructure and configuration as code, as well as service auto-scale capabilities.</li><li> Worked in Devops and Agile environments, Blend of both Development and SRE mindset</li><li> Systematic problem-solving and troubleshooting skills coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.</li><li> Participate in on call rotation. Participate, collaborate, and provide guidance in retrospectives.</li><li> At least 4 years of hands-on operational experience supporting the following or related experience:</li><li> Azure Virtual Network, VWAN, Express route, Load Balancer (L4/L7), Traffic Manager, CDN, Azure DNS, routing &amp; routing protocols like BGP, firewall concepts</li><li> Azure Identity including any of the following: Azure AD, PIM, Conditional Access, MFA, Azure AD Connect, Password less sign-ins, Microsoft Defender, key vault</li><li> Azure Governance, Security, Monitoring, Workbooks, Compliance, and cost awareness</li><li> Azure Virtual Machines, Containers and/or Kubernetes and/or OpenShift (infrastructure perspective)</li><li> Azure Storage Account, Disk, Snapshot, Backup, Site Recovery, file sync, Data Lake.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Certifications in Azure Administrator, Azure DevOps, Azure Solutions Architect.</li></ul><p><br></p>#DICEJobs<p><br></p>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<p><br></p>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<p><br></p>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at tad@retailbusinessservices.com.<p><br></p>For more information, visit https://www.retailbusinessservices.com.<p><br></p>Job Requisition: 306569_external_USA-IL-Chicago_6152023<p><br></p>

title: Site Reliability Engineer.
description: <strong>Site Reliability Engineer<br><br></strong>Power Home Remodeling group is a leader in the home remodeling industry, and has a robust technical infrastructure built to support both employees and customers. Power has a strong focus on company culture, teamwork, and the ability for everyone to contribute to achieving goals.<br><br>Power is looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to work at our headquarters location in Chester, PA. SREs at Power build and maintain the infrastructure that supports our mission-critical applications. The SRE department has a strong focus on automation, scalability, networking, storage, as well as deploying and managing core infrastructure applications, such as orchestration platforms, logging and metrics. The primary responsibilities of an SRE is to deploy and manage existing infrastructure, as well as guarantee the security, stability, and availability of existing applications and infrastructure.<br><br>Power is a fast growing company, and we are looking to onboard more experienced technical engineers to help expand our capabilities. SREs at Power will work with a focused and dedicated team of IT professionals to achieve their goals.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Maintain and upgrade existing infrastructure, using automation tools (Ansible, Puppet) and scripts (Bash, Python)</li><li>Participate in a 24/7 on call rotation using PagerDuty to respond to and resolve problems and incidents</li><li>Manage and help grow existing Kubernetes environments, as well as deploy new ones</li><li>Management of core infrastructure applications such as centralized logging and metrics<br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Soft Skills<br><br></u></strong>Ability to communicate and work effectively in a team<br><br>Ability to work in a Agile environment to track work and progress<br><br>Ability to propose and implement custom in house applications to meet business needs<br><br><strong><u>Required Technical Experience<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ansible/Puppet or similar automation tools</li><li>Working with container infrastructure (preferred Docker and Kubernetes)</li><li>Scripting in Python or similar language</li><li>Writing and using Bash scripts</li><li>Linux management and automation (Ubuntu, RHEL, CentOS)</li><li>Have participated in a 24/7 on call rotation</li><li>Git work flow</li><li>Monitoring and alerting systems</li><li>Visualization of application and system metrics</li><li>Experience with virtualization technologies (VMWare, OVirt)</li><li>Ability to effectively diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve complex technical issues</li><li>Designing, planning, expanding, and managing a complex technical environment</li><li>Working with centralized logging infrastructure</li><li>Working with centralized authentication and authorization systems (LDAP, OIDC)</li><li>Writing applications in Python (or similar language)</li><li>Debugging and updating custom infrastructure applications<br></li></ul><strong><u>Nice To Have But Not Required Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ability to work with vendors to set requirements and generate proposals/contracts</li><li>Hands on experience with hardware and physical datacenter</li><li>Ability to define and implement SLO/SLIs</li><li>CI/CD process and tooling</li><li>Familiarity with database (SQL, NoSQL)</li><li>Capacity planning and expansion<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>Full medical, dental, life and disability insurance plans that can be tailored to your specific needs and the needs of your family</li><li>A competitive 401(k) retirement savings program matched by Power</li><li>Competitive salary</li><li>All the tech you need - We'll pay for whatever hardware and software you need to work and make sure you're regularly upgraded to the latest versions</li><li>Personal development - We provide books, courses and conferences</li><li>Paid parental leave - When the time comes to welcome a new member of the family, we offer paid parental leave</li><li>3 events per year focused on internal development and improvement<br></li></ul><em>Power Home Remodeling Group is an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please submit the </em><em>accommodation</em><em> request to recruiting@powerhrg.com</em>

title: Site Reliability Engineer.
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial’s 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p>In Precision Technology, we make iron smarter. Our team members deliver innovative solutions helping our customers to be more productive, save time, lower costs, and to operate sustainably. From vehicle displays, application controls, steering solutions, digital services and telematics, to fully autonomous driverless technology, we develop solutions that solve challenges for customers around the world.<p><br></p>Design, develop, and evaluate software for embedded systems from concept through production stage, and make modifications as needed.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The Embedded Software Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, IL will be responsible for developing software for CNH Industrial’s onboard Electronics Control Units (ECUs) for Precision Agriculture and Construction Equipment products; developing middleware infrastructure software components such as communication stacks and power management stacks for the onboard controllers; participating in system and software vehicle architecture reviews and providing mentorship for junior developers; designing, developing, testing, debugging and implementing operating systems components, software tools, and utilities using best practice software development processes and code; determining systems software design requirements; conferring with management, production, and marketing staff to determine engineering feasibility, cost effectiveness, and customer demand for new and existing software products; coordinating field testing of software products and systems; communicating with vehicle platforms to provide regular updates of software development activities and progress; documenting and demonstrating solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, and diagrams to support problem analysis; developing clear and concise well-structured and documented source code applicable for software re-use across multiple controllers; participating in requirements, design, and source code reviews; maintaining released code, as needed; and identifying and implementing opportunities for software process and development cycle time improvements. May telecommute up to three days a week. Salary: $132,710 - $ 163,300 /year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Requires a Bachelor's degree in Electrical or Electronic Engineering or closely related field plus five years of embedded system development experience. The five years of experience must include five years of experience with each of the following: 1) working on software applications to support the development of platform and core software; 2) C, C++ for drivers, middleware, application development; 3) designing, developing, testing and implementing operating system components, software tools and utilities; 4) defining system software design requirements; 5) coordinating field testing of software products and systems; 6) maintaining code and releases and developing structured document source code for re-use across other controllers; 7) identifying and implementing software process and development cycle time improvements.<p><br></p>CNH Industrial America LLC' s ongoing employee referral program does apply to this position.<p><br></p>Interested candidates should apply online at http://cnhindustrial.com/<p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventative care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: ServiceNow Engineer (CTH)
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p>Responsible for all aspects of the x86 hardware and software lifecycle for Virtual and Windows server solutions. Core competencies include but are not limited to VMware and Windows operating systems, x86 hypervisors, scripting/automation, HCIS and x86 hardware solutions. Works in agile product delivery team. Interfaces with Product Owner, Product Architect, Application Development and Operations teams on standards exceptions or troubleshooting of issues relating to hardware/OS/application integration.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SME-level accountability for a specific technology and backup/secondary responsibility for another technology.</li><li>Documents current environments, SOPS, future directions, technical designs, change tickets, and other items for internal operations as well as external auditors.</li><li>Will be the escalation point for other team members and knowledgeable of all team technologies.</li><li>Responds to engagements from the Command Center and 1st level operations teams to provide production fixes and root cause analysis. Available on a pager rotation for 24x7 support </li><li>Experience supporting Microsoft Windows Server technologies</li><li>Installation, configuration, and administration of virtualization infrastructures running on VMware suite of products</li><li>Experience with x86 and HCIS platforms (Nutanix, Cisco UCS)</li><li>Strong Powershell or Ansible scripting experience, especially with the goal of automation</li><li>Experience working under a Change Management umbrella, with strong policies and approval chain</li><li>Able to demonstrate a strong engineering mindset throughout the project lifecycle</li><li>Able to take responsibility and will pro-actively look to identify and improve existing processes and practices within the environment</li><li>Excellent Communication skills (spoken/written English) are a must, strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Must be able to multi-task and respond effectively under pressure</li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, </strong><strong>here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years’ experience in large enterprise systems engineering, or related experience</li><li>Certification: Windows, VMware</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)
description_json: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p>Responsible for all aspects of the x86 hardware and software lifecycle for Virtual and Windows server solutions. Core competencies include but are not limited to VMware and Windows operating systems, x86 hypervisors, scripting/automation, HCIS and x86 hardware solutions. Works in agile product delivery team. Interfaces with Product Owner, Product Architect, Application Development and Operations teams on standards exceptions or troubleshooting of issues relating to hardware/OS/application integration.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SME-level accountability for a specific technology and backup/secondary responsibility for another technology.</li><li>Documents current environments, SOPS, future directions, technical designs, change tickets, and other items for internal operations as well as external auditors.</li><li>Will be the escalation point for other team members and knowledgeable of all team technologies.</li><li>Responds to engagements from the Command Center and 1st level operations teams to provide production fixes and root cause analysis. highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, </strong><strong>here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years’ experience in large enterprise systems engineering, or related experience</li><li>Certification: Windows, VMware</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>Job details<p><br></p><strong>Innovative technology Start-up looking for a software developer</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by Caitlin Johnson<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary $100,000 - $140,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A Bit About Us</strong><p><br></p>IT Consulting Company is a leading product development professional services company. The leadership and senior engineering team are deeply talented with unparalleled experience in industry and consulting services. Our client base includes some very well-known Fortune 100 brands as well as budding startups. Because of our explosive growth, we are seeking talented individuals to join our team<p><br></p>Our company is seeking highly motivated application software engineers who would enjoy working on diverse and challenging products. We are looking for individuals who have high creativity balanced with strong engineering fundamentals. We seek developers experienced in multiple environments with expertise in a diverse set of programming languages and technologies.<p><br></p><strong><br><br><strong>Why join us?<br></strong></strong><p><br></p>The ability to work with cross-functional engineering teams is required. We seek high-energy individuals who are self-directed, take responsibility and can manage their individual work; satisfying customers who expect on time and budget delivery that meets or exceeds requirements. Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills are required.<p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field.</li><li> 1-2 years of experience in software development using Xamarin technology, or WPF.</li><li> Experience with mobile application development on iOS and Android platforms.</li><li> Strong understanding of C#, .NET, and client-side technologies like Xamarin Forms, WPF, WinForms, ect.</li><li> Familiarity with Agile development methodologies.</li><li> Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.</li><li> Analyze and maintain existing software applications.</li><li> Design highly scalable, testable code.</li><li> Discover and fix programming bugs.</li><li> SQL database or relational database skills.</li></ul><p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.<p><br></p><strong>Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?</strong><p><br></p>Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>

description: We are looking for <strong>React Developers</strong> with experience ranging from junior to senior level.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Creating and developing web applications using React and other front-end tools </li><li>Working with designers to translate graphical designs into visually appealing and intuitive user interfaces </li><li>Ensuring application performance and scalability through code optimization and problem-solving related to performance </li><li>Collaborating with the back-end team to integrate the front-end application with systems and databases </li><li>Testing and debugging applications to ensure reliability </li><li>Keeping up with the latest trends and tools in front-end development and improving skills to continuously enhance the quality of created applications </li><li>Collaborating with the project team and management to understand business requirements and adjust work to company goals </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 2 years of experience working with React </li><li>Very good programming skills in JavaScript and TypeScript </li><li>Knowledge of software architecture, design patterns, and software development according to best practices </li><li>German language with minimum level B2 </li><li>Additional advantage will be knowledge of other technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>We Offer</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>B2B contract type </li><li>Full-time employment </li><li>Remote and flexible working hours </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong>

title: Site Reliability Engineer.
description: <strong>Address: </strong>USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza<p><br></p><strong>Store Code: </strong>Greenville Data Center - It (5118626)<p><br></p>Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company’s 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, which includes Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Purpose:</strong><p><br></p>Platform Reliability Engineer will help ensure service availability, identifying and automating manual processes, and bridging the gaps between product development teams and operations. Implementing operational improvements in availability, latency, performance, efficiency, change management, monitorChriing, incident response, patch management and capacity planning are all within scope for this role. Whether it’s done through code, the introduction of modern tools, and/or better processes continuous improvement and efficiency is the goal.<p><br></p>You’ll provide operational excellence with troubleshooting skills, ownership in supporting various Azure services<p><br></p><strong>Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Builds, manages, and operate Azure Core Services with automation and infrastructure as code</li><li> Manages, and operates the continuous delivery framework and tools, manages, and automates the lifecycle of the different platform components and help support product teams</li><li> Leverage cloud architecture, applying site reliability principles, full-stack troubleshooting skills across network, application, security, Identity, OS, Containers, on-prem, and distributed services layers.</li><li> Lead and set strategy, roadmap for cloud reliability and recommend best practices for Operations</li><li> Mentor the team members to follow the frameworks and guide them to accelerate delivery of projects</li><li> Provide reasoning about system &amp; application architecture as well as be comfortable looking at code and offering feedback on how it can be improved to increase reliability.</li><li> Identify opportunities and drive the implementation of automation to improve patch management, service health, manageability, reliability, and telemetry.</li><li> Own, triage, investigate and resolve service issues with an emphasis on broad communications, learning &amp; teaching throughout the process</li><li> Design process or technology solutions that monitor, identify, and resolve platform, system, deployment, and environmental issues both prior &amp; post production releases, and ensure measurable improvements against Service KPIs.</li><li> Drive Security and compliance aspects for services in accordance with Azure compliance requirements.</li><li> Engage in service capacity planning, demand forecasting and work towards Azure cost optimizations.</li><li> Create and document Runbooks, Operational procedures, and Standards on confluence</li><li> Communicate on a deeply technical level with product engineering, project management and product teams to improve and optimize products, improve infrastructure, and evolve services.</li><li> Work within a project management/agile scrum teams in a support role as part of a wider team</li><li> Remain current on new technologies, methods and procedures including, but not limited to, coding practices such as Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment and Operational excellence/</li></ul><p><br></p>Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field</li><li> 8+ years of IT experience focused on infrastructure which includes server, storage, network, security, Identity</li><li> 4+ years of experience supporting, maintaining, and automating Azure environments</li><li> 3+ years of experience using IaC tools (ARM, Terraform, JSON,YAML, PowerShell, Github etc…)</li><li> Production experience in Cloud technologies - Azure IaaS, PaaS, networking, Azure functions, Azure automation and runbooks, workbooks, Insights, Security center, Azure Monitor, Log Analytics.</li><li> Ability to read, write, configure, design, and script end-to-end service telemetry, alerting and self-healing capabilities for platform services, lead the execution and ongoing management of services</li><li> Ability to work in an Extreme Programming environment and work in a paired programming/operating model, able to lead the team and help remove roadblocks</li><li> Able to facilitate diverse teams, multi-task, and work under pressure to meet aggressive schedule targets</li><li> Hands on experience with IaC tools like ADO, ARM, terraform, ansible, PowerShell, python, azcli, github</li><li> Experience in service capacity planning, demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning</li><li> Technical and Operational expertise in Windows/Linux/VMware/Hyper-V/AKS, SQL and N0-SQL DB’s, IaaS, PaaS, FaaS, Data, BCDR, Security, Management, Storage, Networking, Monitoring, Identity and Connectivity</li><li> Experience managing and maintaining code repos, build systems, and CICD pipelines</li><li> Experience in infrastructure and configuration as code, as well as service auto-scale capabilities.</li><li> Worked in Devops and Agile environments, Blend of both Development and SRE mindset</li><li> Systematic problem-solving and troubleshooting skills coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.</li><li> Participate in on call rotation. Participate, collaborate, and provide guidance in retrospectives.</li><li> At least 4 years of hands-on operational experience supporting the following or related experience:</li><li> Azure Virtual Network, VWAN, Express route, Load Balancer (L4/L7), Traffic Manager, CDN, Azure DNS, routing &amp; routing protocols like BGP, firewall concepts</li><li> Azure Identity including any of the following: Azure AD, PIM, Conditional Access, MFA, Azure AD Connect, Password less sign-ins, Microsoft Defender, key vault</li><li> Azure Governance, Security, Monitoring, Workbooks, Compliance, and cost awareness</li><li> Azure Virtual Machines, Containers and/or Kubernetes and/or OpenShift (infrastructure perspective)</li><li> Azure Storage Account, Disk, Snapshot, Backup, Site Recovery, file sync, Data Lake/</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Certification in Azure Administrator -required, Azure DevOps -preferred, Azure Solutions Architect -preferred</li></ul><p><br></p>LI-RV1 #DICEJobs<p><br></p>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<p><br></p>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<p><br></p>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at tad@retailbusinessservices.com.<p><br></p>For more information, visit https://www.retailbusinessservices.com.<p><br></p>Job Requisition: 306572_external_USA-IL-Chicago_6152023<p><br></p>

Participate, collaborate, and provide guidance in retrospectives.</li><li> At least 4 years of hands-on operational experience supporting the following or related experience:</li><li> Azure Virtual Network, VWAN, Express route, Load Balancer (L4/L7), Traffic Manager, CDN, Azure DNS, routing &amp; routing protocols like BGP, firewall concepts</li><li> Azure Identity including any of the following: Azure AD, PIM, Conditional Access, MFA, Azure AD Connect, Password less sign-ins, Microsoft Defender, key vault</li><li> Azure Governance, Security, Monitoring, Workbooks, Compliance, and cost awareness</li><li> Azure Virtual Machines, Containers and/or Kubernetes and/or OpenShift (infrastructure perspective)</li><li> Azure Storage Account, Disk, Snapshot, Backup, Site Recovery, file sync, Data Lake/</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Certification in Azure Administrator -required, Azure DevOps -preferred, Azure Solutions Architect -preferred</li></ul><p><br></p>LI-RV1 #DICEJobs<p><br></p>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<p><br></p>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at tad@retailbusinessservices.com.<p><br></p>For more information, visit https://www.retailbusinessservices.com.<p><br></p>Job Requisition: 306572_external_USA-IL-Chicago_6152023<p><br></p>

title: Cloud Platform Engineer - AZURE
description: WorldQuant develops and deploys systematic financial strategies across a broad range of asset classes and global markets. We seek to produce high-quality predictive signals (alphas) through our proprietary research platform to employ financial strategies focused on market inefficiencies. Our teams work collaboratively to drive the production of alphas and financial strategies – the foundation of a balanced, global investment platform.<p><br></p>WorldQuant is built on a culture that pairs academic sensibility with accountability for results. Employees are encouraged to think openly about problems, balancing intellectualism and practicality. Excellent ideas come from anyone, anywhere. Employees are encouraged to challenge conventional thinking and possess an attitude of continuous improvement.<p><br></p>Our goal is to hire the best and the brightest. We value intellectual horsepower first and foremost, and people who demonstrate an outstanding talent. There is no roadmap to future success, so we need people who can help us build it.<p><br></p>Technologists at WorldQuant research, design, code, test and deploy firmwide platforms and tooling while working collaboratively with researchers and portfolio managers. Our environment is relaxed yet intellectually driven. We seek people who think in code and are motivated by being around like-minded people.<p><br></p><strong>The Role:</strong> WorldQuant is seeking exceptional C++ developers to join our front office development team to further enhance and build our next generation trading platforms.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Write low latency, high throughput C++ code</li><li>Implement mission critical trading infrastructure</li><li>Work with portfolio managers to implement new trading systems</li><li>Adapt existing systems to our next generation trading platform</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Bring</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A minimum of 4 years of writing high performance C++</li><li>Modern C++ knowledge (C++17/20, etc)</li><li>C++ template meta programming knowledge</li><li>Possess in-depth knowledge of network programming and distributed computing</li><li>Strong knowledge of Unix/Linux fundamentals</li><li>Strong understanding of data structures and algorithms</li><li>Finance experience is preferred but not required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Locations:</strong> Chicago, NYC, CT, or Austin<p><br></p>WorldQuant is a total compensation organization where you will be eligible for a base salary, discretionary performance bonus, and benefits. The estimated salary range for this position is $125,000 to $250,000 which is specific to New York and may change in the future. When finalizing an offer we will take into consideration an individual’s experience level and the qualifications they bring to the role to formulate a competitive total compensation package.<p><br></p>By submitting this application, you acknowledge and consent to terms of the WorldQuant Privacy Policy. The privacy policy offers an explanation of how and why your data will be collected, how it will be used and disclosed, how it will be retained and secured, and what legal rights are associated with that data (including the rights of access, correction, and deletion). The policy also describes legal and contractual limitations on these rights. The specific rights and obligations of individuals living and working in different areas may vary by jurisdiction.<p><br></p>Copyright © 2023 WorldQuant, LLC. All Rights Reserved.<p><br></p>WorldQuant is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in hiring on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation or preference, age, marital status, citizenship, national origin, disability, military status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, or any other protected characteristic as established by applicable law.

description: <ul><li>Team of 10 Permanent Software Development Recruiters working in C#/.NET|New roles getting added all the time, would love to be a resource!<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our clients range in size and industry - generally we partner with growing technology companies where software developers can make an impact, find challenging and interesting projects, and advance their careers long term. Some of our best clients are in SaaS, Fintech/Finance, Retail, Education, Healthcare, and Software Consulting. All the roles my team works are permanent - we do not have any contract opportunities in our portfolio. Most of the roles my team work will involve some in-office Hybrid component, even fully remote roles require permanent residency in the Chicagoland area.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>Generally speaking - our clients are looking to bring on highly skilled software engineers to build out new greenfield features or applications, migrate old technology to better functioning newer versions, and create new innovative solutions to generate more growth for their firms in the short and long term<br><br><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. description: One of the biggest banking companies  is looking for multiple  sr. level full stack .NET developers  to join their team!<ul><li>Highly collaborative team working on the latest technologies</li><li>24 month contract to hire that can convert full time early based on performance</li><ul><li>We have had individuals convert full time as early as 4 months</li></ul><li>Hybrid once a week in Atlanta, GA (near Hartsfield airport) or Chicago, IL (near the Willis Towers)</li><li>Skills required:</li><ul><li>.NET Core or later versions</li><li>Angular 2 or later versions (they are on version 14)</li><li>10+ years of experience</li></ul><li>Nice to haves:</li><ul><li>Financial/banking experience</li><li>Cloud (they will be moving to PCF or Azure in the future)</li><li>Agile</li></ul><li>Must be able to work W2, no C2C or sponsorship available</li><li>Interview process:</li><ul><li>30 minute screening call</li><li>1 hour technical interview</li><li>Immediate feedback after or next day<br></li></ul></ul> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.
description_json: One of the biggest banking companies  is looking for multiple  sr. level full stack .NET developers  to join their team!<ul><li>Highly collaborative team working on the latest technologies</li><li>24 month contract to hire that can convert full time early based on performance</li><ul><li>We have had individuals convert full time as early as 4 months</li></ul><li>Hybrid once a week in Atlanta, GA (near Hartsfield airport) or Chicago, IL (near the Willis Towers)</li><li>Skills required:</li><ul><li>.NET Core or later versions</li><li>Angular 2 or later versions (they are on version 14)</li><li>10+ years of experience</li></ul><li>Nice to haves:</li><ul><li>Financial/banking experience</li><li>Cloud (they will be moving to PCF or Azure in the future)</li><li>Agile</li></ul><li>Must be able to work W2, no C2C or sponsorship available</li><li>Interview process:</li><ul><li>30 minute screening call</li><li>1 hour technical interview</li><li>Immediate feedback after or next day<br></li></ul></ul> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. title: Cloud Reliability Engineer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, ESPO Engineering Corp, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong> Full Stack Developer<p><br></p><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago, IL<p><br></p><strong>Job type and Duration: </strong>Permanent / Full-time<p><br></p>Our client, a global Architecture and Design Firm, is hiring a Full Stack Developer to join their team in Chicago, IL.<p><br></p>The Full Stack Developer is a highly skilled computer programmer who is comfortable with both front and back-end programming. Responsibilities include participating in user interviews, developing and designing front end web user interfaces from a composable architecture, integrating existing data sets and models, developing and maintaining semantically driven object ontologies, and ensuring the responsiveness of applications, among other duties.<p><br></p>This position will be required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.<p><br></p><strong>Job Duties</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participation in user interviews to understand technical and customer needs.</li><li>Developing front-end website architecture based on Palantir Foundry.</li><li>Designing user interactions on web pages within Palantir Foundry Workshop.</li><li>Developing back-end website code logic that leverages semantic object linking (ontologies) within Palantir Foundry Code Workbook and Ontology Manager.</li><li>Creating servers, databases, and datasets for functionality as needed.</li><li>Ensuring the health of data connections and pipelines (utilizing filesystem, JDBC, SFTP, and webhook).</li><li>Ensuring conformance with security protocols and markings on sensitive data sets.</li><li>Ensuring responsiveness of web applications developed on low code/no code solutions.</li><li>Ensuring cross-platform optimization for mobile phones.</li><li>Seeing through projects from conception to finished product.</li><li>Meeting both technical and customer needs.</li><li>Staying abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages.</li><li>Lead other engineers to develop features on your projects.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, management information systems, or related field.</li><li>Minimum 5 years experience.</li><li>Strong organizational and project management skills.</li><li>Proficiency with low-code/no-code tools, Palantir Foundry experience preferred.</li><li>Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.</li><li>Familiarity with JavaScript libraries such as Lodash, Math.js, Moment, Numeral, and es6-shim.</li><li>Proficiency with server-side languages for structured data processing; Python, PySpark, Java, Apache Spark, and SparkSQL in particular.</li><li>Familiarity with database technology such as MySQL, Oracle, MongoDB, and others.</li><li>Familiarity with analytical tools for business intelligence and data science such as Power BI, Jupyter, and R Studio.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>ESPO Corporation</strong><p><br></p><strong> View all open jobs at </strong><p><br></p><strong>Leaders in Technical Recruiting &amp; Staffing since 1965</strong><p><br></p>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and value the benefits of diversity in our workforce . All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, or any other attribute or protected characteristic by law. If you need assistance applying please contact us directly.

title: Execution Developer
description: Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>Job details<p><br></p><strong>Venture-backed blockchain infrastructure startup is hiring for a Remote Senior Rust Engineer!</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by Sydney Weaver<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary $150,000 - $500,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A Bit About Us</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Rust Engineer to join our fast-growing LL2 crypto infrastructure startup. As a Senior Rust Engineer, you will play a key role in designing, implementing, and optimizing our core systems and infrastructure using the Rust programming language. Join our dynamic and innovative team, and be part of shaping the future of LL2 crypto infrastructure. We offer competitive compensation, benefits, and a stimulating work environment where your expertise will be highly valued and your ideas can make a significant impact!<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Design, build, and maintain our blockchain infrastructure using Rust</li><li> Work closely with our team of developers to ensure the smooth operation of our blockchain platform</li><li> Develop and implement security protocols to protect our blockchain infrastructure</li><li> Monitor and troubleshoot any issues that arise with our blockchain platform</li><li> Collaborate with other teams to integrate our blockchain platform with other systems</li><li> Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in blockchain technology and make recommendations for new features and improvements</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><br><br><strong>Why join us?<br></strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Great health benefits package, PTO / Vacation, 401K + match</li><li> Remote work (local to USA)</li><li> Great culture, innovative team, and growth opportunity </li><li> Highly competitive comp package with a base salary + cash bonus + token or equity. </li><li> Opportunity to make a high impact on both the company’s product and as well as the industry at large.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a talented and experienced Blockchain Infrastructure Engineer to join our Engineering team. As a Blockchain Infrastructure Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our blockchain infrastructure. You will work closely with our team of developers to ensure the smooth operation of our blockchain platform. This is a permanent position in a dynamic and exciting startup environment.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 2 + years of experience at a crypto native startup, preferably blockchain infrastructure</li><li> Strong experience with Rust programming language</li><li> Experience working with crypto native startup</li><li> Deep understanding of blockchain technology and protocols</li><li> Experience with blockchain security protocols and best practices</li><li> Knowledge of distributed systems and networking</li><li> Ability to work independently and as part of a team</li><li> Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills</li><li> Strong communication and collaboration skills</li></ul><p><br></p>If you are passionate about blockchain technology and have a proven track record of building and maintaining blockchain infrastructure, we want to hear from you. This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing startup and make a significant impact on the future of blockchain technology.<p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.<p><br></p><strong>Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?</strong><p><br></p>Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>

title: DevOps Engineer (GCP) German language*
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial's 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The Display Systems Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, Illinois will be responsible for driving the timely, efficient, and cost-effective design of agriculture and construction equipment display and cluster products. Develop requirements and associated system architecture, system designs, test cases, and acceptance criteria. Interface with the Vehicle Integration Engineers to ensure that the displays are successfully integrated into the target vehicle electrical systems. Harmonize the UI/UX HMI designs with the display component software design. Work with the Safety Engineers to fulfill the necessary Functional Safety requirements (ISO25119). Work with the Network Architecture team to ensure that the displays and clusters meet all applicable protocol standards and performance requirements. Troubleshoot problems and develop root cause through hardware and software failure analysis and testing. Support plants, suppliers, and customers with resolving issues. Support the Project Manager(s) with System Engineering estimates and resource planning. Actively assisting the Project Manager with managing external supplier(s) to ensure that their deliverables meet the project requirements and overall project needs. Aid Project Managers with resource planning. Develop future roadmaps to maximize design commonality for display and cluster products across all vehicle product lines. Salary: $134,120-156,000/year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Electronics Engineering or directly related field plus five years of experience in product development and developing displays for automotive or commercial vehicles. The five years of experience must include two years of experience with each of the following: 1) developing system requirements, system architecture, system design, and test cases; 2) automotive in-vehicle communications architectures and protocols including CAN, J1939, LIN; 3) creating test plans and test scripts using Python and C++; 4) using CANalyzer for vehicle data measurement and analysis; 5) using MATLAB, Simulink for system development and analysis; 6) UML diagrams for system interfaces and user interfaces; and 7) a requirements management tool.<p><br></p>CNH Industrial America LLC' s ongoing employee referral program does apply to this position.<p><br></p>Interested candidates should apply online at http://cnhindustrial.com/<p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventive care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: Ruby on Rails Developer
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>This role is responsible for applying basic knowledge to the design and development of embedded applications on hardware platforms. The focus in this role includes creation of technical specifications, application firmware design and development, and support for manufacturing and regulatory approval. Knowledge of basic software development practices and principles is required. An Engineer 2, Firmware must support their peers in day-to-day development activities and be able to troubleshoot platform defects of limited complexity. This role will be responsible for both individual and team based software development activities<p><br></p>Job Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and implement application level firmware solutions to meet business needs</li><li>Work with stakeholders to understand functional requirements of systems to accurately develop designs, implementations and test cases</li><li>Design and develop application firmware using best practices that adhere to product specifications using an Agile development process</li><li>Create and maintain technical specifications as related to product development</li><li>Work with senior engineers to implement scalable designs and modular functional blocks that meet product requirements</li><li>Use design analysis techniques such as FMEA or rate monotonic analysis to validate software designs prior to implementation. Ability to accurately document an intended design is critical</li><li>Create unit test cases that accurately test interface functionality and responses to varied inputs both in and out of scope</li><li>Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve firmware defects as found during bench, lab, and production QA testing</li><li>Apply software quality tools such as Lint, Understand, and other static and dynamic analysis tools to verify software releases meet quality and coding standards</li><li>Support regulatory engineering for FCC and other outside agency approval of end products</li><li>Support manufacturing on site during as needed for engineering and production builds</li><li>Manage own work to deliver according to project schedules; be accountable for delivery</li><li>Actively contribute to the adoption of software architecture, best practices, and technologies</li><li>Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect Chamberlain Group’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reading professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p>Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering, related technical field or equivalent practical experience</li><li>An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>1+ years of job-related experience as defined in the Essential Duties and Responsibilities</li><li>Able to travel up to 10% - domestically and internationally</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work within cross functional teams to create electro-mechanical products; strong analytical skills; effective communication skills; Oriented programming experience; TCP, UPD, HTTP, WebSockets, MQTT, or other connected protocols</li><li>Agile/Scrum experience</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

Required Skills &amp; Experience \u003cul\u003e \u003cli\u003eExperience with C#, .NET \u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eExperience with JavaScript/Angular and UI work \u003c/li\u003e\u003cli\u003eExperience working with SQL server, T-SQL \u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e Desired Skills &amp; title: Full Stack Developer
description: Over all 6-8 years of experience<p><br></p><ul><li> Should know how to Patching - Linux Stack</li><li> SQL Server - Change management</li><li> MYSQL/PHP - knowledge</li><li> Apache Knowledge - BASH/Python</li><li> Release management</li><li> Generate Compliance Report in terms of Patch/Application.</li><li> Create Software Update groups with monthly Microsoft Office Updates and Third Party Updates.</li><li> Verify all previous missing patches based on Vulnerability list from Tenable and add them to Software Update Groups.</li><li> Responsible for requirements gathering and requirements analysis in area of specialization.</li><li> Work with stakeholders to understand current state and to identify the future state for the proposed solution.</li><li> Analyze data and identify gaps in the proposed solution, make recommendations for resolving gaps, and monitor results.</li><li> Conduct requirement gathering sessions with business. Produce the requirement documentation (Functional and non-functional).</li><li> Should be an excellent Team player, self-starter, multi tasked, detail oriented.</li><li> Excellent Communication and Technical writing skills.</li><li> Should be able to work with people (Business, IT and QA) in requirement gathering sessions/workshops</li></ul>
