title: PLC Software Developer - Siemens
description: <ul><li>Be apart of sports and technology company expanding massively |Work on greenfield developments with a collaborative team<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>The client focuses on Youth Sports and Development. The offer a robust platform that organizes national events, practice and game schedules as well as individual athletes data. Having experienced tremendous growth in recent years they are looking for a Lead React Native Developer to play a key role in continuing to grow their platform.<br><br>They're currently the leading provider of technology solutions for all of the youth sports team in the US, operating web and mobile platforms with over 1M on boarded users. They have a clear career path with a chance to grow within the company to a managerial or leader role. They develop greenfield projects designed to enhance the experience of youth athletes and simplify the process of scheduling and making payments for their parents.<br><br>This is a hybrid opportunity with commute to the office required once a week.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Write clean, scalable code using React Native</li><li>Utilize front-end web technologies to create interactive user experiences</li><li>Develop SQL Database-driven web interfaces</li><li>Create and test prototype when needed</li><li>Develop client displays and user interfaces in Fullstack capacity</li><li>Use, rework and adapt existing web application for mobile apps <br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>6 + years of software development experience</li><li>Experience coding in React native</li><li>Experience working on Mobile applications</li><li>Strong attention to detail, looks to input creative solutions to help minimize excess redundancies </li><li>Experience with SQL databases - either relational and/or non-relational experience </li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li>Experience working with REST APIs</li><li>Clear documentation <br><br></li></ul><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li> Salary ranging from $165k-$200k</li><li> On-boarding period to help the transition run smoothly</li><li> 401k with 4% company match. No waiting period for matching</li><li> Strong health/dental/vision packages offered</li><li> Unlimited PTO with flex time</li><li> Collaborative team environment</li><li> Unlimited growth potential with career path laid out</li><li> Performance bonus and equity.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Connor Whitman<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-072023-6110540</strong>

title: Firmware Engineer II
description: <strong><u>Your Impact: </u></strong><p><br></p>Rauland is looking for a talented and passionate Firmware Engineer who wants to make an impact in the medical &amp; educational space. We are seeking an experienced developer who will help us build and enhance tools and applications that are used by thousands of healthcare providers and patients worldwide for the latest in acute and long-term care facilities and the applications used by the educational institutions.<p><br></p><strong><u> What You'll Do: </u></strong><ul><li> Design and buildout firmware for a new generation of Rauland designed hardware SKUs. </li><li> Participate in all aspects of the software development life cycle from requirements review to product verification. </li><li> Create or review:</li><ul><li> System, sub-system and functional requirements </li><li> Software architecture and detailed design documents </li><li> Software verification plans </li><li> Software build and deployment plans. </li></ul><li> Participate in code inspections. </li><li> Work with the assigned software architect to design and code solutions. </li><li> Work with verification and validation engineers to resolve test failures. </li><li> Work with the technical support group to troubleshoot field problems. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u> Do You Have?... </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent. </li><li> At least 5 years development experience in design and implementation of multi-task, event-driven real time embedded development. </li><li> Expertise with development tools for revision control, bug tracking, peer code review, etc. </li><li> Linux kernel development and integration </li><li> Low Level driver development </li><li> Integrating board support packages from RTOS vendors </li><li> Excellent knowledge of OS coding techniques, IP protocols, interfaces and hardware subsystems </li><li> Developing firmware using an RTOS </li><li> Integrating hardware and firmware </li><li> Codec programming and integration </li><li> Experience reading schematics and data sheets for components. </li><li> Experience using emulators and hardware debugging tools. </li><li> Experience with IAR Workbench or similar embedded IDEs. </li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u> Why Us? </u></strong><p><br></p>Rauland, a division of AMETEK, is a business unit in the Measurement, Communications and Technologies division of AMETEK. We are a leader in integrated communications technology, designing and manufacturing Nurse Call Systems for the medical industry and school critical communication systems for the education K-12 market.<p><br></p>Website: www.rauland.com<p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation</u></strong><p><br></p>Salary Minimum: Market<p><br></p>Salary Maximum: Market<p><br></p>Incentive: No<p><br></p>Disclaimer: Where a specific pay range is noted, it is a good faith estimate at the time of this posting. The actual salary offered will be based on experience, skills, qualifications, market / business considerations, and geographic location.<br><br>AMETEK is committed to making a safer, sustainable, and more productive world a reality. We use differentiated technology solutions to solve our customers’ most complex challenges. We employ 18,500 colleagues, in 30 countries, that are grounded by our core values: Ethics and Integrity, Respect for the Individual, Diversity and Inclusion, Teamwork, and Social Responsibility. AMETEK (NYSE:AME) is a component of the S&amp;P 500. Visit www.ametek.com for more information.<br><br>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process should call 1 (866) 263-8359.

description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, ReqRoute, Inc, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Client Snapshot: </strong><p><br></p><strong>Client</strong> is a leading, “global ten” provider of custom information technology, consulting and business process outsourcing services, and serves primarily Global 2000 companies.
